title: Customer Service Specialist
description:
**Customer Service Specialist**
Bold Penguin is a leading integrated digital solution platform dedicated to simplifying small commercial insurance. Our technology makes the quote and bind process quick, effortless, and profitable for all parties - agents, brokers, and carriers. Bold Penguin’s innovative product suite has digitized and transformed a slow, manual process resulting in reduced costs, increased efficiency, and better overall outcomes. For more information, please visit www.boldpenguin.com.
Or, simply put….
We simplify commercial insurance.
**Applicants must reside within the state of Ohio, position is remote.**
**YOUR ROLE**  

  

As the primary pilot of our software product, the Customer Service Specialist is the focal point of where technology meets the human touch at Bold Penguin. The Customer Service Specialist, manages a portion of our named accounts, including new customer onboarding activities and providing front line support. You will guide new customers through the onboarding process, including account set up and activation, provide best practice documentation and be an available resource. Additionally, you will assist in managing customer needs day to day, especially as it pertains to incoming chats and support cases.  

  

**WHAT YOU’LL DO**
* Consistently deliver excellent service through customer queries (support tickets), email, live chat, and phone.
* Ensure all partner needs are met through frequent partner interactions covering status, account changes, servicing issues and overall account performance
* Manage and coordinate agency appointment requests with the assistance of our carrier partners.
* Manage customer records in our CRM, ensuring account-level, contact-level, and opportunity/sales-level accuracy
* Coachable attitude with a passion for learning.
* Adapt to new processes and technologies as they are developed and deployed.
* Communicate and multitask effectively.
* Contribute to a high energy, positive environment.


  

**SKILLS AND QUALIFICATIONS**
* Strong communication and multitasking skills
* Coachable attitude with a passion for learning
* Ability to drive and carry a conversation
* Proactive approach to problem solving
* Comfortable working with CRM tools, Google Apps, Microsoft Office
* Self-motivated, action and results oriented
* Previous experience in a call center or in-office customer service role
* Bachelor’s Degree preferred
* Commercial Insurance experience is a plus


**BENEFITS**  

  

After 90 days in this role, we offer competitive compensation and progressive benefits that include:
* Medical, Dental and Vision
* Disability and Life Benefits
* 401K with a company match
* Employee Assistance Program
* Parental Leave
* Paid Time Off


  

**Remote Culture.** Here at Bold Penguin our remote employees are top of mind, and we have created an inclusive, engaging remote environment.
**Stay connected to the Glacier.** We slack. A lot. We also like to video conference regularly. With all-hand "Waddles" held each week.  

  

**Penguin bling.** Like swag themed after a certain Antarctic bird? Just. You. Wait.  


The starting pay rate for this role is $23.00/hour.
*Bold Penguin believes in inclusion. That’s why we’re proud to be an equal opportunity employer that considers all qualified applicants regardless of race, color, religion, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. To learn more about our results-focused culture and employee-focused perks, read more on our* *careers page**.*
  

If you are an applicant who resides in the state of California, please review our Employee Privacy Notice here.

title: Marketing Specialist (Remote)
description:
Authority Brands Inc. headquartered in Columbia, MD is a leading provider of home services, building brands that support the success of our franchisees, as well as bettering the lives of the homeowners we serve and the people we employ.
  
  

The Marketing Specialist will assist in overall marketing efforts within the Sure Start Marketing program for the Trade Brands. This role is an integral part of the planning and execution of business pre-open and post-open marketing strategies aimed at viable leads to our newest franchise partners.
  
  

**Responsibilities:**  

* Work with Sure Start Marketing Manager, Trade Brands Marketing Managers, operations teams, and greater Authority Brands team to outline, plan and execute strategic marketing plan and initiatives for the Trade Brands.
* Help franchise partners develop and manage local marketing budgets.
* Move projects from ideation through to completion, and track status of projects.
* Be knowledgeable about trends in brands’ data including lead flow, booking rate, close rate, and other KPIs. Understand marketing’s contribution to these KPIs and actively contribute to their improvement with the marketing team.
* Complete research and present recommendations for marketing naming conventions, based on franchise-partner local market needs and trends.
* Help manage brands’ websites, including working with website partners, vendors, and internal teams to ensure accuracy of brand information, approval of franchisee submitted content, implement franchisees’ requested changes, and new location website launches, digital footprint pieces and creative graphic requests.
* Complete online presence audits to ensure consistency across online presence for franchise locations.
* Support marketing team in the analysis of marketing performance and results and help communicate these to franchise partners and other teams.
* Assist in onboarding new franchise partners and introduce them to the marketing system and available assets and strategies and provide ad hoc strategic support.
* Develop and manage franchisee-facing content such as weekly meeting agendas, task checklists, training and other educational items.
* Interact with franchise partners, vendors and internal teams, serving as a guide and project manager during their onboarding process. Develop best practices for cross-brand collaboration and sharing.


**Qualifications:**  

* Self-motivated, results-oriented, confident, and passionate.
* Comfortable with creating new processes, establishing organization and structure in environments without much existing process and structure.
* Knowledge/understanding of digital marketing, including ability to interpret digital campaign results (SEO, PPC, remarketing, display).
* Excellent problem-solving skills.
* Energetic, open to collaborative and dynamic environment, business minded, strategic and creative.
* Public presentation skills, targeted at influencing audiences to achieve company goals.
* Open to both receiving and giving constructive feedback in a professional manner and context.
* Remaining open-minded to ongoing and dynamic change, as market trends, company shifts, and resource alternations occur.
* Keeping our franchise partners’ business success at the forefront of our why and our how.


We believe our greatest assets are our employees, we offer competitive salaries and a full benefits package to include, PTO, paid holidays, 401(k) and more.
  
  

Authority Brands Inc. conducts drug screens and background checks on applicants who accept employment offers. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions however we do not sponsor Visa’s at this time.
  
  

Authority Brands Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer

title: Digital Marketing Specialist (Remote)
description:
**Digital Marketing Specialist (Per-Project Contract) - Grow with Us!**

Our high-performance creative agency is seeking an experienced Digital Marketing Specialist to join our team! We're seeking a talented and creative Digital Marketing Specialist to join our team on a freelance basis, with the potential to transition into a part-time role.

The Digital Marketing Specialist will support, execute, and drive digital marketing and content strategy for clients by leveraging best-in-class industry insights, rigorous competitor analysis, and proven brand development methodology.

This candidate will also play a pivotal role in building our internal capabilities as we continue to concretize our position as one of the most progressive cloud-based creative agencies on the planet.

Digital Marketing Specialist will enjoy:

* Flexible work hours
* Remote friendly
* Performance bonuses
* Paid for professional development
* Self-regulated remote work optimizing work-life balance
* Flexible, fun work environment with a highly diverse and creative team
* Ability to influence our brand on a direct and immediate level

**Digital Marketing Specialist Requirements:**

* 2-3+ years of experience managing results-driven organic marketing campaigns at a digital product company or agency
* Bachelor's degree required
* Strong content generation skills
* Proven track record of ROI across digital marketing channels
* Deep understanding of split testing, audience segmentation, conversion tracking, deliverables, KPIs, etc.
* Extensive Hubspot and knowledge of CRM software preferred.
* Experience within Technology/SaaS, finance, fintech, real estate, Web3, cryptocurrency, and lifestyle sectors
* Strong sales and closing experience a plus
* Experience writing clear briefs, ensuring that all teams have the necessary information to achieve a diverse range of campaign outcomes
* Strong analytical skills and detail orientation
* Positive action-oriented attitude and professional demeanor
* Ability to adapt and thrive in a fast-paced, deadline-driven environment
* High-integrity team player oriented toward collaboration, leadership, and communication within cross-functional teams
* Experience in the following platforms is preferred but not required: Google Suite, Slack, Loom, Google Analytics, Basecamp, and HubSpot.

**Digital Marketing Specialist Responsibilities:**

Leverage content and digital marketing skills and analysis to both create and enhance brand awareness, demand, and increased conversions by:

* Creating value-driven, high-performance content including, but not limited to, fixed word count articles & blogs, social media posts, website copywriting, PPC ads, and newsletters.
* Ensuring all work adheres to the client's overarching marketing strategy and primary objectives, while monitoring conversions, evaluating/adjusting campaigns to maximize ROI
* Recommending and executing strategies for content development with creative stakeholders including content collaboration, creation, and optimization
* Understanding buyer personas and motivations to ensure content is optimized to communicate customer needs and tailor tactics across audience touchpoints
* Providing monthly KPIs, performance as well as action plans for growth.
* Building necessary technical workflows to measure and map client campaigns
* Working across teams to assist throughout multiple campaign stages
* Staying current with client-related trends, industry news, developments, and best practices

All offers for independent contractor status are contingent on passing background checks. All hires will be made Independent Contractor status with potential eligibility to become a W2 Employee.

**Who We Are**

*We maximize global exposure by sculpting key messages that speak to a universal audience*

Powered by innovation and deeply embedded in a digital-first ecosystem, Adaptive Intelligence prides itself in delivering innovative and clear messaging that resonates with an ever-evolving end-consumer. Our professional offerings are end-to-end, from content creation to brand architecture.

We are now seeking a Digital Marketing Specialist to join our rapidly expanding team. While we're based in New York City, our operations are digital, and your work will be remote.

Job Type: Contract

Pay: $40.00 - $75.00 per hour

Benefits:

* Flexible schedule

Schedule:

* Choose your own hours
* Monday to Friday

Supplemental pay types:

* Bonus opportunities

Application Question(s):

* How familiar are you with split testing, audience segmentation, conversion tracking, deliverables, KPIs, etc.?
* Are you available and willing to pass mandatory training for consideration?

Education:

* Bachelor's (Required)

Experience:

* Digital marketing: 2 years (Required)

Language:

* English (Required)

Work Location: Remote

title: Account Executive, Digital Marketing
description:
**Position Summary**


MyAdvice is hiring true hunters/closers ready to break into the lucrative digital marketing sales industry by consulting with medical practitioners on our cutting edge, proprietary SaaS marketing platform. Account Executives are responsible for elevating MyAdvice by ultimately helping our clients grow through a robust online presence. This is an experienced sales position meaning you must be familiar with digital marketing and have robust closing and hunting experience. This is a high volume, outbound, hunter sales role where you’ll be expected to source new business from scratch while owning the full sales cycle.


MyAdvice's Account Executives (AEs) will identify ideal client profiles, assess the practice’s unique online marketing needs then cater outreach to capitalize on selling a feature suite that maximizes value. AEs will accomplish this by exercising proven sales acumen to act as the authority on medical marketing concepts by utilizing their extensive MyAdvice product knowledge, excellent technical skills and strong understanding of industry trends. Successful AEs are skilled communicators and presenters who find the best fit between client and platform features.


Our ideal candidate is one who works well under pressure, is highly self-motivated and easily initiates relaxed, yet informative, two-way conversations with prospects. They are coachable, adaptable, tenacious, excellent multitaskers and organized. The right candidate is able to convey potentially unfamiliar technical concepts to prospective clients in an easy-to-understand manner. They’re focused on enhancing the buyer experience and comfortable challenging prospects to ensure results. Ultimately, our best fit for Account Executive is one that’s passionate about not only their own personal excellence, but also their client’s success.


MyAdvice is proud to offer its sales team robust support. Your sales manager isn’t afraid to “get their hands dirty” by working 1:1 on skills development, offering custom coaching and actually demonstrating what it takes to close a deal. You’ll enjoy further mentorship by seasoned MyAdvice sales professionals that’ve been with our company over a decade. We also have a tuition reimbursement program and a well-defined career path from AE to Senior Account Executive. Product knowledge training and sales skills coaching is backed by a solid tech stack to prioritize your time on outreach and closing. While you’re expected to hunt your own leads, you'll also be supported by an in-house marketing team and dedicated lead generation specialist.

* **This position can be remote, hybrid or in-office depending on candidate preference and location.** MyAdvice has offices in Melville, New York and Lehi, Utah.

**Essential Duties**

* Passionately present MyAdvice platform features to new prospects to generate new sales
* Educate prospects through a consultative sales approach paired with a transactional close process
* Grow business by calling on marketing leads and self-generating new prospects
* Demonstrate comprehensive product and industry knowledge to articulate value to prospects
* Hold yourself accountable to and carry a quota of net-new closed revenue
* Maintain pipeline management through sales software
* Collaborate with others on the sales and marketing teams to ensure goal attainment
* Relentlessly drive to achieve personal and company goals
* Maintain a positive and resilient attitude
* Perform other duties as assigned

**Tech Stack + Resources**

* MacBook, monitor and headset provided
* Apollo (lead database)
* Zoom (video conferencing)
* TalkDesk (softphones system)
* Pipedrive (Sales-specific CRM)
* PandaDoc (contract processing software)
* Dedicated in-house marketing team providing inbound marketing leads
* In-house lead generation specialist providing high quality, curated lead lists that meet company ICP
* Sales skill development, custom coaching plan and training on industry best practices

**Required Skills**

* Strong interpersonal skills; must be able to negotiate, problem-solve, make decisions and act as the authority on MyAdvice’s platform of marketing features and services
* Exceptional oral and written communication skills
* Demonstrated business acumen and a deep understanding of sales processes
* Well versed in CRM, presentation, video conferencing and other business software
* Medical, dental or marketing sales experience (preferred)

**Required Qualifications**

* Minimum of 3-5 years of account executive, B2B sales, outside sales or territory sales experience
* Must have a working knowledge of digital marketing concepts; minimum 2 years experience
* Bachelor’s degree in Sales, Marketing, Communications or related field *preferred*
* Must have reliable internet, phone and a professional, quiet/private workplace
* Legally authorized to hold employment within the United States

**Position Details**

* Schedule: Monday-Friday, typical business hours (early-out Fridays!)
	+ For example: 8am-5pm or 9am-6pm with an hour lunch break
	+ Flexible scheduling available per manager’s approval
	+ Occasional after-hours work may be required depending on prospect’s availability
* Travel: May require occasional local or national travel (less than 5% of the time, if at all).
* Physical Requirements: Prolonged periods sitting at a desk and working on a computer (90% at desk, 10% of time walking); Ability to lift up to 30 lbs and use typical office equipment (computers, keyboards, printer, etc.)

**Benefits Package**

* Employer Contributed Plans: Medical, Vision, Life and AD+D Insurances
* Voluntary Plans: Dental, Critical Illness, Accident and Pet Insurances
* Unlimited Paid Time Off + 12 Paid Holidays
* Remote-first Company, Flexible Schedules + Early Out Fridays!
* 401(k) Plan with 50% Company Match (up to 6%)
* Employee Assistance Program (free mental health services, financial/legal consultations and more!)
* Tuition Reimbursement Program (up to $1,800 annually) and Executive Mentorship Program
* Leadership Training Program: Learn the basics of how to lead a team! Available to all employees.
* Ongoing Personalized Coaching and Career Development
* Casual Dress and Fun Work Environment (games, coffee, snacks, etc.)
* Perks at Work Employee Discount Program
* Core Value "Pay It Forward" Initiative, Project Fantastic (client collab) and more!

**MyAdvice**
MyAdvice empowers business owners and professionals to increase their revenue by attracting and retaining more clients through digital marketing. The SaaS-based platform enables hands-on control and visibility into performance of online marketing activities, backed by 20+ years of best practices and expertise on how to maximize those efforts. MyAdvice’s six-stage Pyramid of Success™ provides a proven step-by-step plan for how and when to implement growth-oriented marketing tactics for greatest impact, including website design and maintenance, local directories, client reviews, social media, search engine optimization (SEO) and paid advertising. Learn more at myadvice.com.


We are committed to diversity and inclusion as we understand and value its importance to our success. Our team thrives upon our employee's unique experiences to propel creative solutions, so we aspire to continue building upon our diverse team to include groups that are traditionally underrepresented. Additionally, studies have shown that minorities are less likely to apply for a position if they don't meet every qualification. MyAdvice prioritizes a strong company culture fit and believes in providing opportunities to individuals with exceptional work ethic. Skills can be taught. With that in mind, if you believe yourself to be a good fit, we strongly encourage people of all backgrounds to apply.


MyAdvice is a performance based and data driven company that has experienced tremendous growth within the last year, so we're excited for the opportunity to introduce new talent. MyAdvice’s progressive values include transparency, teamwork, relentless effort and intellectual honesty in order to bring about the success of our clients. We encourage continuous education, career development and work/life balance while thriving in a casual and collaborative work environment. With MyAdvice you will be a valued and integral member whom we will continually invest.

title: Digital Marketing - SEO Specialist
description:
Caputo Design is a fast-growing Technology and Internet Marketing Agency. We provide Web Design, Development, SEO, PPC, Social Media and internet marketing services for small and large businesses. We are looking to hire an ambitious individual who wants work with fantastic clients and grow with a great team all from the comfort of your own home!

**About You:**

* **Independent:** You enjoy working without a boss looking over your shoulder and are driven to create your own success. Together we will create a plan and define what success looks like.
* **Always Learning:** You have a desire to push the limits and are always striving to learn new things. We support new ideas and constant curiosity that can take you to the next level.
* **Detail Oriented:** You have an insane desire to make sure everything is perfect and you take great pride in your work.
* **Wear Many Hats:** While this position will have basic requirements to get started, we are looking for a team player that wants to learn all aspects of the business. If you have a passion for design, we want to use that. If your passion is on the development side, we want to figure out how to let you tap into that as well. Your main focus will be as an SEO Specialist but the possibilities are endless.

**Requirements:**

* At least 5 years of experience with SEO & local SEO (Google + Local)
* Be able to maintain normal office hours in a quiet working environment with a fast internet connection
* Love being part of a virtual team atmosphere
* Experience with clients from a Franchise based business a plus
* Solid understanding of WordPress admin environment
* Expert knowledge of Google Analytics & Google Search Console
* Comfortable conducting client calls one-on-one
* Maintain and continuously optimize client accounts
* Provide internal and external reporting with regards to the status of a project and how client and company goals are being met
* Extract insights from multiple sources (e.g. Google Search Console, Google Analytics, SEM Rush, Moz, our own custom reports, etc.) in order to identify and provide well developed and impactful recommendations
* Must be detail oriented and very thorough with your work
* Need to be able to thrive in a fast pace environment
* Must be a quick learner
* Passion for Internet Marketing is a must!

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $50,000.00 - $55,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

Application Question(s):

* You notice a reduction in conversion rate on a clients website. What are the first few things to check that could be a cause?
* If we told you have 3 hours to work on a website. What are the first things you would do within those hours to optimize for organic search?
* What is your desired salary range?

* High school or equivalent (Preferred)

Experience:

title: Digital Marketing Specialist
description:
**We’re looking for a digital marketing specialist with a focus on online advertising.** This individual will work directly with the agency owners to assist in all aspects of the website build and digital marketing processes with an emphasis on the creation, management, and optimization of online advertising campaigns — specifically, Google Ads and Facebook Ads. Good candidates will like crunching numbers, enjoy managing and being responsible for other people’s money, and have strong analytical / architecturally-oriented minds.

**Responsibilities**

* Set up and edit WordPress websites
* Set up and manage Google tools including Google Analytics, Google Tag Manager, Google Search Console, and Google Workspace
* Create, manage, and optimize advertising campaigns on Google Ads, Facebook Ads, and additional media buying platforms
* Build and interpret marketing reports with actionable insights
* Respond quickly to client inquiries and communicate with them proactively
* Participate in meetings with clients (over the phone & via Google Meet)
* Manage project timelines and client expectations

**Requirements**

* Enjoys working from home
* Self-disciplined
* Self-starter
* Loves writing
* Strong attention to detail (i.e. “Perfectionist”)
* Okay with math (you don’t have to love math, but there is a good amount of basic math involved)
* Okay managing and being responsible for spending other people’s money

**Preferred**

* Familiarity with digital marketing tools and terminology
* Experience with Excel / Google Sheets

**How to Apply**

Send an email with the subject line “Digital Marketing Specialist Application” with your attached resume and cover letter to contact@evergrowmarketing.com.

Job Type: Part-time

Pay: $16.00 per hour

Expected hours: 15 – 20 per week

Work Location: Remote

title: PPC Specialist
description:
**About**

Small counseling practice in Texas that provides mental health diagnosis and treatment through an inclusive and affirming lens. Specialties include depression, anxiety, building self-esteem and interpersonal skills, LGBTQ issues and grief.

Google Ads and Analytics specialist needed to improve conversions and targeting for small existing PPC campaign. You will work directly with the business owner of a small private practice in healthcare, so ability to discuss technical decisions and PPC marketing strategy with a non-specialist is important. Experience with Wordpress and healthcare-related marketing are a big plus. Expect us to meet virtually a few times over 2-3 weeks to discuss strategy, campaign revisions, and results follow-up. If results are positive you may be contacted for future PPC campaigns as well.

Job Type: Temporary

Pay: $20.00 - $25.00 per hour

Expected hours: No more than 20 per week

Schedule:

description:

title: Paid Social Media Buyer
description:
**About Tierra:**

Tierra is a performance marketing agency focused on driving profitable customer acquisition for DTC ecommerce and lead generation businesses. Headquartered in Carlsbad, California we are a fast-paced, fun, and ever-evolving creative team that helps online entrepreneurs scale beyond their wildest dreams.

At Tierra, our values define us and push us to be our best. We’re always leveling up ourselves and each other because we never settle for less. We're passionate about our process because we know it works. Where others only see problems, we imagine solutions. We always do the right thing, and most importantly, we enjoy the ride. After all, if we’re not having fun, what’s the point?

**Job Summary:**

Are you obsessed with media buying? Do you live and breathe ecommerce, conversion rates, and maximizing ROAS? Are you constantly immersed in media buying groups, forums, and sharing new strategies, techniques, and ideas? If so, we have the perfect opportunity for you.

As a Senior Media Buyer - Paid Social Media (Meta and TikTok) at Tierra, you'll be at the forefront of driving high-performing traffic for ecommerce and lead gen clients. We're seeking someone who not only understands social Ads Manager inside and out but also thrives on developing innovative strategies to drive profitable traffic on platforms like Meta and TikTok at high scale.

This role isn't just about running ads; it's about crafting marketing strategies that deliver results. You'll be responsible for ensuring that client KPIs and budgets are met on a daily, weekly, and monthly basis. From evaluating creative assets to refining audience targeting, you'll leave no stone unturned in the pursuit of client success.

We're looking for someone who is wildly creative yet meticulously data-driven. Someone who sees every ad creative as a sum of many parts, with strong hooks, problem-solving narratives, and compelling calls to action that can be tuned and optimized for maximum impact.

This is a challenging opportunity with immense growth potential and bonus opportunities for passionate marketers who genuinely care about client success. If you're ready to unleash your creativity, dive deep into data, and drive real results, we want to hear from you!

**Responsibilities:**

* Build, manage, and optimize performance campaigns on Meta and TikTok
* Manage budgets ranging between $1,000-$50,000 per day, per client.
* Budget management on a daily, weekly, and monthly basis.
* Continually evaluate and recommend optimizations to hit revenue goals.
* Manage and analyze performance in Meta and TikTok analytics.
* Generate weekly and monthly reports highlighting key metrics and providing insights into optimizations.
* Use data to drive marketing decisions.
* Support landing page optimization
* Work with brand and in-house creative strategists and graphic designers to manage and meet all deadlines on ad creative deliverables.
* Prepare advertising testing schedules and timelines for brand onboarding, campaign launch, and ongoing account optimization and maintenance.
* Stay up to date with platform updates and trends.

**Qualifications:**

* 5+ years of paid Meta/Facebook advertising experience.
* 2+ years of paid TikTok advertising experience.
* Extensive knowledge of Facebook ads manager and Facebook’s advertising creative standards.
* Strong knowledge of Facebook’s advertising algorithm, audience segments, bidding strategies, and scaling techniques.
* Track record of efficient conversion based campaigns (NOT focused on engagement metrics such as likes, comments, shares, etc.).
* Must have an advanced understanding of split testing, reporting, and optimization for performance-based KPIs.
* Clear understanding of difference between branding and direct response initiatives.
* Excellent writing and verbal communication skills.
* Experience working with Facebook sales and customer success teams to mitigate / resolve issues.
* Experience managing Facebook advertising budgets exceeding $100,000 monthly.
* Advanced knowledge of Google Analytics, UTM parameters, pixels, and conversion attribution.
* The ability to stay humble and check your ego at the door.
* Proactive contributor who leverages the resources and technology at their disposal to solve problems

**Benefits:**

* Compensation commensurate with experience.
* Bonus opportunities based on performance.
* Choice of fully remote or hybrid work schedule (if in San Diego area)
* Unlimited PTO and flexible working hours.
* Full health benefits (including medical, dental, and vision care).
* A genuine focus on employee happiness and mental health.
* Opportunities for internal advancement and growth.
* A team that puts “We” above “I”, celebrates each other when successful, and supports each other when challenged.
* Clients that are dedicated to making a positive change in the world.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $75,000.00 - $100,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Dental insurance
* Flexible schedule
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday
* Weekends as needed

Supplemental pay types:

* Bonus opportunities

Work Location: Remote

title: Digital Content Specialist
description:
**AZAD Technology Partners is seeking a Digital Content Specialist for a full-time, Remote, W2 Contract position.**

**Schedule:** Full-time, 40 hours/week, Fully Remote.

**Assignment Duration**: 12 Months with possibility of extending.

**Compensation & Benefits:** Compensation is between 32.00 - 37.00 hourly. Benefits include a Co-paid Medical, Dental and Vision Insurance, Cafeteria Plan, and 401k, as well as the option for Paid Time Off (dependent on amount requested).

**Summary:**  
The Content Editor will be someone who wants to solve content challenges and can see the big picture for what the future can and should be, while being able to act upon that vision and drive the work forward today.   
We are seeking a strategic thinker who loves to pull together disparate thoughts, ideas, and activities and bring them together to provide an ideal solution.

**Typical task breakdown:**  
Provide ongoing content support related to content updating and analyzing. Deliverables are typically Excel sheets and graphs and PowerPoint decks.  
Content editor will be an expert in Excel being able to pull reports, manipulate data and create easily digestible graphs and charts.  
Write and review SEO-optimized content for support business needs; edits content as required.  
Working with product groups to keep part taxonomy up-to-date. You will take in feedback from product groups and create the best user-experience.  
Project management experience - the Content Editor will be able to own projects from conception to completion with keen attention to detail and organization.  
Apply ethical SEO best practices when performing tasks such as keyword research, competitive analysis, meta tag creation, and social media optimization.  
Work closely with SEO manager to help optimize product titles and descriptions.   
Deep understanding of content development. The Content Editor will work closely with the development team.  
Work cross-functionally with internal business partners to understand content needs.

**Education & Experience Required:**  
Four-year bachelor's degree preferably in Marketing, Communications, or related field. 

**Technical Skills (Required):**  
3-5 years of experience writing web or technical content.  
Experience using keyword research tools to extract insights and actionable data.  
Experience managing a website taxonomy.  
SEO experience.  
Experience with a PIM.  
Ideally has experience in construction or a related field.  
Excel and presentation skills.  
Experience as a digital marketing copywriter or similar content producer.  
Desire to continually learn, research, and evolve based on changing SEO strategies and various behaviors of online search engines while considering global differences.  
Excellent writing and editing skills.  
Attention to detail.

**About Us:** 

AZAD Technology Partners values diversity - in backgrounds and in experiences.  
Since our inception, we have witnessed how our diverse workforce has thrived while contributing to the increases in innovation and advancements in the client organizations we serve.

AZAD Technology Partners is committed to Diversity, Equity & Inclusion and is striving to build an even more diverse, inclusive team that reflects the people and communities where we live and work.

AZAD Technology Partners is an equal opportunity employer that considers and employs qualified individuals based upon job related qualifications regardless of race, color, sex, religion, creed, physical or mental disability, veteran's status, sexual orientation, national origin, age, or any other status protected under applicable local, state or federal law.

AZAD Technology Partners takes affirmative action to employ and advance in employment qualified employees and applicants who are disabled, disabled veterans, recently separated veterans, Armed Forces services medal veterans, and other protected veterans.

  AZAD Technology Partners is a Certified Minority Owned Business and OFCCP compliant.

Job Types: Full-time, Contract, Temporary

Pay: $32.00 - $37.00 per hour

Expected hours: 40 per week

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Life insurance
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift

Application Question(s):

* Are you a U.S. citizen?

Work Location: Remote

title: Web Chat Representative
description:

title: SEO Specialist
description:
**Company Overview:**  
Copeck Digital Media Group is a leading digital marketing agency dedicated to helping businesses enhance their online presence and drive organic traffic through strategic SEO initiatives. We specialize in developing customized SEO strategies that align with our clients' goals and deliver measurable results. As we continue to expand our team, we are seeking a talented and analytical SEO Specialist to join us in optimizing our clients' websites for improved search engine visibility and performance.

**Position Overview:**  
We are looking for a detail-oriented and results-driven SEO Specialist who is passionate about optimizing websites for search engines. The ideal candidate will have a solid understanding of SEO best practices, algorithms, and tools, along with a proven track record of implementing successful SEO strategies. From conducting keyword research to monitoring performance metrics, the SEO Specialist will play a key role in improving our clients' search rankings and driving organic traffic to their websites.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Conduct comprehensive SEO audits of clients' websites to identify strengths, weaknesses, and opportunities for optimization.
* Perform keyword research to identify relevant and high-performing keywords for content optimization and targeting.
* Optimize website content, including meta tags, headers, URLs, and internal linking structure, to improve search engine visibility and relevance.
* Develop and implement on-page and off-page SEO strategies to improve website rankings and drive organic traffic.
* Monitor and analyze website performance metrics, including organic traffic, keyword rankings, and conversion rates, using tools such as Google Analytics, Google Search Console, and SEMrush.
* Identify technical SEO issues and work with developers to implement solutions, such as site speed optimization, mobile responsiveness, and structured data markup.
* Stay up-to-date on industry trends, algorithm updates, and best practices in SEO to continuously improve our strategies and methodologies.
* Collaborate with content creators, web developers, and other cross-functional teams to ensure SEO best practices are integrated into website design and content creation processes.
* Provide regular reporting and insights to clients on SEO performance, including recommendations for improvement and optimization opportunities.
* Stay abreast of competitors' SEO strategies and industry benchmarks to identify areas for differentiation and competitive advantage.

**Qualifications:**

* Bachelor's degree in Marketing, Computer Science, Business, or related field.
* Proven experience as an SEO Specialist or in a similar role, with a strong track record of improving search engine rankings and driving organic traffic.
* In-depth knowledge of SEO principles, algorithms, and best practices, including on-page and off-page optimization techniques.
* Proficiency in SEO tools and analytics platforms, such as Google Analytics, Google Search Console, SEMrush, Moz, and Ahrefs.
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to interpret data, draw insights, and make data-driven recommendations.
* Excellent communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively with cross-functional teams and communicate complex SEO concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
* Detail-oriented mindset and ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously in a fast-paced environment.
* Continuous learner with a passion for staying updated on the latest SEO trends, techniques, and industry developments.

**Benefits:**

* Competitive salary and benefits package.
* Flexible work schedule and remote work options.
* Opportunities for professional development and training.
* Collaborative and supportive work environment.
* Opportunity to work with a diverse portfolio of clients across various industries.

If you are a proactive and results-oriented SEO Specialist looking to make a significant impact in the digital marketing space, we encourage you to apply today! Please submit your resume, cover letter, and any relevant portfolio or examples of past SEO projects and successes.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $24.65 - $29.69 per hour

Benefits:

* Flexible schedule
* Health insurance
* Paid time off

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Monday to Friday

Work Location: Remote

title: Sr. Paid Search Specialist / Digital Marketing
description:
BuildASign aims to make it easy and affordable for people to share their message or tell their story with custom and personalized products. We relentlessly innovate and improve to provide customers with exceptional value and an experience that fosters a long-lasting relationship. The Austin, Texas-based organization has grown since the company's inception in 2005 to include more than 400 employees. BuildASign also operates EasyCanvasPrints.com and AlliedShirts.com. We are passionate about attracting top talent that will relentlessly innovate and continue to help our double-digit revenue and profit growth trajectory.


**Position Overview:**



We are seeking a highly skilled and motivated Sr. Paid Search Specialist to join our dynamic digital marketing team. As a Sr. Paid Search Specialist, you will be responsible for developing, implementing, and optimizing our paid search campaigns to drive high-quality traffic and achieve business objectives. The ideal candidate is analytical, data-driven, and has a proven track record of managing successful paid search campaigns.



This role is remote-first and has in-office requirements in Austin, TX . Team members must reside in Texas.


**Key Responsibilities:**



Strategy Development:


* Develop and execute paid search strategies aligned with business goals.
* Conduct thorough keyword research and analysis to identify new opportunities.


Campaign Management:


* Create and manage paid search campaigns across various platforms (e.g. Google Ads, Bing Ads).
* Monitor and optimize campaign performance to achieve KPIs and maximize ROI.
* Implement A/B testing for ad creatives, landing pages, and other campaign elements.
* Knowledge of display networks (e.g. Google Display Network, Criteo) and display campaign management tools (e.g. DV360, DSP's) a big plus.


Budget Management:


* Set and manage advertising budgets to ensure cost-effective campaign performance.
* Monitor and adjust bids to maintain competitive positions while controlling costs.


Analytics and Reporting:


* Utilize analytics tools to track, analyze, and report on campaign performance.
* Provide regular insights and recommendations based on performance data.


Collaboration:


* Work closely with cross-functional teams, including design, content, and development, to align paid search strategies with overall marketing efforts.
* Collaborate with external partners and vendors as needed.


**To be Successful:**


* Strong analytical skills and the ability to interpret data to make informed decisions.
* Excellent communication and collaboration skills to work effectively in a cross-functional team environment.
* Detail-oriented with strong organizational and project management abilities.
* A drive to learn and grow constantly and ability to implement new strategies.


**Qualifications:**


* Bachelor's degree in Marketing, Business, or a related field.
* 4+ years of experience in paid search management.
* In-depth knowledge of paid search platforms (Google Ads, Bing Ads) and analytics tools.
* Highly proficient in Excel.
* Experience with BI tools and SQL is a plus.
* Experience with Amazon sponsored products advertising a plus.
* Certifications in Google Ads and Bing Ads are a plus.
* This position is remote-first in Austin, TX and has in office requirements. Must reside in Texas.

title: Marketing Specialist

title: Social Media Contractor
description:
As a Social Media Contractor, you'll play a pivotal role in driving engagement and visibility across various channels. Your responsibilities include crafting compelling social media copy for weekly editorial articles and sponsored content, planning and executing promotional strategies for webinars, managing event campaigns, and creating engaging posts for reports and guides. Working closely with our staff liaison, you'll ensure seamless integration with overall marketing goals, providing regular updates and incorporating feedback to optimize our social media presence for maximum impact.


**Essential functions and responsibilities:**


**Weekly Editorial & Sponsored Articles:**


* Craft social media copy for weekly editorial and sponsored articles.
* Schedule and post editorial content as it's released.
* Share 7-20 articles per week.


**Webinar Promo Planning:**


* Develop a promotional content calendar for 3 weeks of social advertising per webinar.
* Write engaging social media copy and schedule posts.


**Event Campaigns:**


* Create compelling social media copy and schedule 1-2 posts per week for Spring and Fall Conferences, with occasional additional campaigns.
* Execute media partnership social media posts as per contracted agreements.


**Reports and Guides:**


* Write captivating social media copy and schedule posts for SB Reports and Guidebooks released throughout the year.


**Working with SB Staff:**


* Collaborate closely with the SB staff liaison to ensure alignment with overall marketing strategies and messaging.
* Provide regular updates on social media content plans, including scheduling and performance metrics.
* Incorporate feedback from the staff liaison to optimize social media campaigns and initiatives for maximum impact and effectiveness.


This recruitment is to fill a Term-Limited Temporary position at 10 hours a week that is anticipated to end in December 2024.

title: Digital Advertising Specialist
description:

**Overview:**

We are seeking a highly skilled and motivated Digital Advertising Specialist with at least 3 years of experience. The successful candidate will be able to show proof of their success managing and optimizing Google and Microsoft Ads as well as Meta advertising.

**Responsibilities:**

title: Local SEO Specialist
description:
Threshold Brands is seeking a dedicated Local SEO Specialist to join our internal Digital Marketing team. This role offers the unique opportunity to work remotely and directly with franchisees who are small business owners. As a Local SEO Specialist, you will play a crucial role in navigating the evolving landscape of Google's search rankings. Your expertise will be instrumental in driving these businesses to the forefront of search engine results pages (SERPs), significantly enhancing their online visibility, and contributing to their digital success.

  



What You’ll Do:

  


* Tackle on-page and off-page SEO tasks for small business owners, including on-page optimization of links and images.
* Create, manage, and troubleshoot Google Business & Facebook profiles.
* Support client needs through Salesforce, zoom meetings, or email.
* Write SEO-friendly landing page content.
* Audit and find organic optimization growth opportunities.
* Participate in keyword research, content research, and client audits.
* Communicate with clients to show results and performance.

  



What You’ll Have:

  


* Strong understanding of Local SEO best practices - bonus points if you have franchise or home service industry experience.
* Google Analytics and GA4 mastery (tracking, tagging, reporting).
* 2-3 years agency experience.
* Ability to think analytically and enjoy searching for the proverbial needle in a haystack.
* Initiative to work both together with the team and independently to get work done.
* Ability to organize your time and juggle multiple projects at once.
* Excellent communication skills.
* Associate degree, at a minimum

  



A few things to Note:

  


* This role is for US-based applicants only
* This role requires traditional business hours
* This role will be heavily client facing

  



WORKING AT THRESHOLD BRANDS

  



This is an exciting opportunity to work at a company that genuinely cares about its employees, franchisees, and customers! A company that believes in work-life balance, that it is okay to have fun on the job, and that invests in its employees by providing challenging opportunities and tools to deliver excellence! If these beliefs ring true to you, we invite you to read on.

  


*What do we do?* We help entrepreneurs achieve their lifelong dream of success through business ownership. As a multi-brand franchisor, we plan to deliver multiple home services through individually owned and operated franchisee throughout the United States and Canada. We help our brands deliver superior customer service by providing a high touch National Contact Center, cutting-edge technology, fun and upbeat marketing and business coaching that adds real value.

  



In a nutshell, our vision is to be *a franchisee-friendly company, empowering entrepreneurs to deliver exceptional services to their communities.*

  


*What are our roots?* It all began in August 2020, when our flagship franchise, MaidPro, partnered with The Riverside Company (a private equity sponsor). Since then, we’ve been moving at a rapid speed growing both organically and through acquisitions. Today, we are 11 brands strong, supporting not only MaidPro but also Men in Kilts, Patio Patrol (formally FlyFoe), Pestmaster, USA Insulation, Plumbing Paramedics, Heating Paramedics, Sir Grout, Granite Garage Floors, Mold Medics and Miracle Method. Our strategy is to keep adding great-performing brands to our portfolio, so we’re not slowing down. We’re headquartered in Boston, Massachusetts, but really, we’re all over the map, with more than 400+ franchise locations across North America.

  



COMPANY CULTURE

  


*Who are we?* We are a collection of entrepreneurs, out-of-the-box thinkers, hospitality minded innovators. We thrive in a fast-paced, high-energy environment and we are steadfastly committed to adding value to everything we do.

  


*Who do we want on our team?* We look for people who are natural learners, passionate about their careers and love to help businesses grow.

  


*Why work here?* We provide a fun place to work where people are nice, learning is continuous, individuality is respected, and your cutting-edge ideas are welcomed. At the same time, we’re straight shooters. We support each other but we also challenge each other. You will be challenged every day, but it will be the best job you ever had.

  



BENEFITS

  



We provide a fun place to work where people are respected, learning is continuous, and cutting-edge ideas are always welcome. Competitive employee-focused benefits include:

  


* Medical, dental, vision and other ancillary benefits on your first day of employment
* Remote work environment
* PTO
* Employee Assistance Program
* 401k Safe Harbor
* Collaborative, fun company environment and culture

title: Digital Marketing Specialist
description:
**Job Description****:**
------------------------

**Digital Marketing Specialist**

**POSITION SUMMARY****:**


Job Title: Digital Marketing Specialist


FLSA Status: Exempt


Type: Full-time


Department: Marketing & Communications


Reports To: Vice President, Marketing


The Digital Marketing Specialist is responsible for the planning and tactical execution of campaigns across all digital marketing channels including, websites and landing pages, marketing automation platform, email, paid and organic social media, SEO, and SEM, as well as assistance with traditional marketing channels such as conferences and events.

**ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:**


Duties and Responsibilities

* Executing digital campaigns utilizing Hubspot as the marketing automation platform.
* Project manage the building of omnichannel digital marketing campaigns.
* Publish content to all ScribeAmerica social media channels and track analytics for each platform.
* Actively monitor all corporate social media platforms, respond to comments, questions, and concerns, and involve appropriate internal resources when necessary.
* Maintain social media analytics dashboards and produce monthly, quarterly, annual, and campaign-specific reports.
* Work with the website team to continually optimize ScribeAmerica websites for user experience, SEO, and conversions.
* Posts public-ready content to ScribeAmerica websites and tracks performance analytics for all published content.
* Creates and manages email, automated marketing, and drip campaigns.
* Builds and maintains paid social media campaigns on all relevant platforms including LinkedIn, Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, YouTube, and TikTok.
* Assists in the logistics planning and execution of ScribeAmerica conferences and events.
* Assists website team with maintaining the company intranet and self-service marketing asset library.
* Assists VP of marketing with developing annual marketing plans and roadmaps.
* Manage PR outreach to industry publications and reporters to keep ScribeAmerica in the larger medical scribe and AI conversations.

**Required Education and Experience**

* Bachelor’s degree in marketing, communications, or similar
* Minimum of 2-3 years experience in digital marketing and communications, preferably in a healthcare or related field
* Display exemplary work ethic, professionalism, and interpersonal skills
* Demonstrate technical capability, strategic thinking, exceptional attention to detail, time management and organization, communication proficiency, and teamwork
* Experience/consistent performance in a deadline-oriented environment.
* Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously and build effective processes to handle recurring tasks.
* Demonstrated ability to work productively with counterparts in a cross-functional capacity.
* Self-starter capable of recognizing needs and opportunities and acting on them.
* Ability to analyze KPIs and communicate the effectiveness of content and campaigns.
* Strong knowledge of current digital marketing platforms and best practices.
* Public Relations and communications experience preferred
* Experience with Huspot and WordPress preferred.
* Design experience and skills are highly preferred.

**Physical Demands**


The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform essential functions.

* Regularly required to talk or hear.
* Regularly required to use a keyboard and computer.
* Frequently required to stand, walk, sit, use hands, handle documents, and reach with hands and arms.


CORE COMPETENCIES

* Active Communication (Verbal, Written, Listening Skills)
* Adaptability
* Attention to Detail
* Composure
* Conflict Management
* Customer Orientation
* Develop Relationships
* Organizing and Planning
* Problem Solving & Decision Making
* Productivity
* Professionalism
* Responsiveness
* Results Oriented
* Team Player
* Technical Expertise

**Position Type/Expected Hours of Work**


This is a full-time position working remotely. As an exempt employee, he or she must be available to work outside of normal business hours at the request of the Vice President of marketing.

**Travel**


Travel is expected occasionally for this position, as needed for particular marketing events.

**Other Duties**  

Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties, or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities, and activities may change at any time with or without notice.


Compensation range: Our compensation range for this position is 50k-60k , depending on qualifications, experience, and geographic location.

*ScribeAmerica provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, national origin, age, disability, genetics, protected veteran status, or any other legally protected group status. In addition to federal law requirements, ScribeAmerica complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation, and training.*

*ScribeAmerica expressly prohibits any form of workplace harassment based on race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, national origin, age, disability, genetics, protected veteran status, or any other legally protected group status. Improper interference with the ability of ScribeAmerica’s employees to perform their job duties may result in discipline up to and including discharge.*

title: Email Marketing Specialist
description:
**ABOUT SMARTSITES**

SmartSites is a young, energetic, and innovative digital media agency. We are a team of over 250 designers, developers, writers, marketers, and problem solvers, who work together to help businesses succeed online.

* SmartSites is an Inc5000 fastest growing private company for six consecutive years (2017-2022).
* Over 1,000 5-star reviews across Google, Yelp, Facebook, UpCity. Clutch, G2 and more.
* 97% of SmartSites employees would encourage their friends to become coworkers -- 1st place in our competitive landscape (Comparably).

**Email Marketing Specialist**

We are seeking a self-driven Email Marketing Specialist to share in our mission in providing best-in-class digital marketing services for small & medium sized businesses. This is a client-facing role that focuses on driving ROI through email & SMS marketing.

**JOB RESPONSIBILITIES**

**Marketing Operations**

* Manage the customer lifecycle through email & SMS channels: segmentation, workflow automation, and attribution.
* Curate email marketing calendars.
* Implement new strategies and creative ideas that help improve customer conversion rates using A/B testing.

**Team Collaboration**

* Work with designers, developers, writers, and marketers.
* Collaborate with other client service teams on co-managed clients: pay per click (PPC), social media, SEO & web services.
* Delegate & manage tasks in our project management portal.

**Client Relations**

* Manage 15-30 clients
* Communicate via email, call, and video conferencing
* Lead meetings such as project kickoffs and marketing performance reviews

**IDEAL CANDIDATE**

* A critical thinker that shares our passion for all things digital. Has a desire to help others, a great eye for detail, an eagerness to learn, and can persuasively communicate ideas.
* Certified in Klaviyo, Mailchimp, or other ESP
* Up-to-date knowledge of email & SMS best practices and compliance
* 1+ years’ experience working in an agency, or similar client-facing environment
* 1+ years’ experience as a project manager or email/SMS marketer
* Familiarity with ecommerce platforms (Shopify, Magento, Woocommerce)

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $40,000.00 - $50,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Flexible schedule
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Parental leave
* Professional development assistance
* Referral program
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

Supplemental pay types:

* Bonus opportunities
* Commission pay

Education:

* Bachelor's (Required)

Experience:

* Email Marketing: 1 year (Preferred)
* Project management: 1 year (Preferred)

License/Certification:

* Klaviyo Certification (Preferred)

Work Location: Remote

title: Inbound Marketing Specialist
description:
Join one of the nation’s leading and most impactful health care performance improvement companies. Over the years, Health Catalyst has achieved and documented clinical, operational, and financial improvements for many of the nation’s leading healthcare organizations. We are also increasingly serving international markets. Our mission is to be the catalyst for massive, measurable, data-informed healthcare improvement through:* Data: integrate data in a flexible, open & scalable platform to power healthcare’s digital transformation
* Analytics: deliver analytic applications & services that generate insight on how to measurably improve
* Expertise: provide clinical, financial & operational experts who enable & accelerate improvement
* Engagement: attract, develop and retain world-class team members by being a best place to work

Role: Inbound Marketing Specialist
Team: Marketing
Location: US, Remote
Travel: <5%, US
Join Our Pursuit of Excellence  

We are looking for an inbound marketing specialist who is an expert at attracting, qualifying, and nurturing leads through inbound marketing tactics and strategies and will be a team player on the Health Catalyst Marketing team.  

We are looking for an organized, data-driven, self-motivated inbound marketer to collaborate with the larger team (e.g., Sales and Marketing) to develop inbound campaigns for clients and prospects. This person will attract, qualify, and triage new customers—and maintain existing customers—through a variety of content initiatives including web forms, content downloads, events, webinars, and other digital campaigns. This role will also be responsible for attracting site traffic, converting that traffic into new leads, and nurturing those leads throughout the  

sales funnel.  

What you'll own in this role:  

* Develop a strong understanding of products, industry competitors, and marketing goals and objectives.
* Manage inbound marketing campaigns that attract qualified prospects to the Health Catalyst website, and convert them into leads and customers using relevant and helpful tactics including emailing and calling, and leveraging content including insights, white papers, eBooks, on-demand webinars, etc.
* Support the execution of marketing campaigns and events in close coordination with marketing program managers and leadership.
* Conduct event outreach and follow-up.
* Measure campaign effectiveness against key performance indicators (KPIs), report metrics to leadership, and continually refine our process to convert customers.
* Use analytic insights to create/improve content strategies.
* Write and edit various marketing materials including emails and communications with Sales.
* Maintain up-to-date knowledge of the industry’s best practices and strategies including inbound marketing.
* Assist with other marketing team duties as needed, including newsletter development, landing page optimization, etc.
  

Who You Are:  

* Alignment with Health Catalyst Cultural Attributes: Continuous Learning, Hardworking, Humble, and World-Class.
* Experience with Salesforce, Marketo, and Salesloft or comparable CRM experience.
* Strong organizational skills with close attention to detail.
* Team player with an ability to self-manage various responsibilities.
* A creative mindset to tackle tasks in innovative, fun, and efficient ways.
* Deadline-motivated delivery of results.
* Exceptional listening, writing, and oral communication to effectively articulate complex ideas.
* Patience and determination to work through occasional tedious tasks.
* Openness to change and flexibility when balancing multiple priorities.
* Previous event marketing or inbound lead management experience.
* Experience with Microsoft Suite, including Word and Excel.
* A bachelor’s degree or equivalent years of experience.
*The above statements describe the general nature and level of work being performed in this job function. They are not intended to be an exhaustive list of all duties, and indeed additional responsibilities may be assigned by Health Catalyst**.*
Studies show that candidates from underrepresented groups are less likely to apply for roles if they don’t have 100% of the qualifications shown in the job posting. While each of our roles have core requirements, please thoughtfully consider your skills and experience and decide if you are interested in the position. If you feel you may be a good fit for the role, even if you don’t meet all of the qualifications, we hope you will apply. If you feel you are lacking the core requirements for this position, we encourage you to continue exploring our careers page for other roles for which you may be a better fit.
At Health Catalyst, we appreciate the opportunity to benefit from the diverse backgrounds and experiences of others. Because of our deep commitment to respect every individual, Health Catalyst is an equal opportunity employer.

title: Product Marketing Specialist
description:
**Product Marketing Specialist**
**Delivering Growth!**
Delivering growth for marketers is what NaviStone is all about. For B2C brands in considered-purchase verticals, we deliver proven, time-tested results. The NaviStone platform empowers marketers by finding, activating, and converting lucrative audiences, with incredible impact!
**The Challenge**
NaviStone is on a mission! We’re moving fast, doubling the size of our business over the next 2 years. As our Product Expert, joining our product management team, you will play a crucial role in bridging the gap between the technical aspects of NaviStone products and the overall business.
**What You’ll Do**
* **Drive product adoption** based on your deep expertise in our product and technology to provide support throughout the organization including marketing, sales and client services.
* **Develop and manage issue escalation and resolution** when new products are not performing as intended.
* **Collaborate with product managers and development teams -** Collaborate **to** understand product roadmaps and upcoming features and translate technical details into customer-facing benefits.
* **Collaborate with cross-functional teams to develop and execute go-to-market plans** for new product launches and updates.
* **Identify and highlight key features** and benefits that resonate with the target audience.
* **Conducting market research** to understand customer needs, industry trends, and a competitive landscape.
* **Partner with Sales -** You will work closely with the sales team to provide them with the necessary tools and resources to effectively sell our products.
* **Assist the sales team-** Support and assist the sales team with questions about new products including but not limited to providing training materials and conducting training sessions.
* **Collaborate with marketing -** Provide input into the production of marketing collateral, including product documentation, case studies, whitepapers, and presentations.
* **Develop clear and compelling messaging** that communicates the value proposition of NaviStone’s product. You will need to ensure there is consistent messaging across all marketing materials.
* **Define target audiences** - Define target audience segments and tailor marketing strategies accordingly.
**What You Will Need to Succeed**
* You have a bachelor’s degree in marketing, computer science, business, or a related field
* You have at least 3-5 years of experience working as a product owner or product specialist with marketing technology and SaaS products
* You can work cross-functionally and manage simultaneous projects and needs
* You bring the ability to manage ambiguity, overcome challenges, and thrive
* You have a willingness to learn, collaborate, and get creative
* You have demonstrated Project Management skills
* You can effectively communicate with and relate to individuals at all levels within the organization and NaviStone customers
* You can effectively partner with teams of all sizes and composition
* You have a personality that thrives on digital innovation and evaluating trends in a changing landscape
***Develop your best you, and reinvigorate for what’s next***
*NaviStone’s benefits, programs, and perks are purpose-built to help you grow stronger professionally, and personally. We offer generous medical, dental, vision, and retirement benefits for you and your family.*
*We never stop growing, and we never stop learning. Want to explore AI? Develop new coding skills? Become a better presenter? Grow your leadership skills? Learn advanced yoga? We offer countless professional and personal development opportunities to fuel your ambitions.*
*We’re a Rocketship, but even Rocketships need rest! We work hard, and we go fast. But we also recharge! With unlimited vacation, a generous number of paid holidays, and fun employee events throughout the year, you can refuel and reinvigorate for the incredible journey ahead!*

title: Digital Marketing Assistant
description:
**Digital Marketing Assistant – Cambridge Innovation Institute**

**Summary**:

Our company is a leader in organizing and hosting educational conferences for the pharmaceutical, battery technology, and other industries. We are seeking a Digital Marketing Assistant to join our dynamic marketing team. This role is pivotal in enhancing our digital presence and engagement through various digital marketing channels. The ideal candidate will bring fresh insights and ideas to optimize these channels, including Organic Search, PPC, and Social Media.

The ideal candidate will have 2-3 years of marketing experience, including at least 1 year of SEO, Analytics, and/or Event Marketing; be an active listener and critical and analytical thinker, providing support and offering input to help meet project goals; and be collaborative and eager to learn and contribute to our team.

**Job Responsibilities**:

· Craft SEO-driven, keyword-dense content for increased organic search visibility.

· Utilize marketing analytics tools for channel analysis, keyword research, organic search trend analysis, and competitor research.

· Manage and optimize Pay-Per-Click campaigns, monitoring performance metrics closely.

· Create and optimize event listings on third party platforms, using engaging content and multimedia.

· Develop and execute social media campaigns, collaborating on campaign objectives and performance analysis.

· Coordinate with design and web teams for the creation of ad creatives and promotional videos.

· Present data-driven insights to various departments, such as preparing and presenting channel reports, weekly team presentations, annual reports, and more.

· Assist across multiple departments with marketing analytics insights.

**Job Requirements**:

· 2-3 years of marketing experience, including at least 1 year of SEO, Analytics, and/or Event Marketing

· Proficiency with digital marketing analytics tools such as Google Analytics 4 and SEMRush

· Stellar interpersonal, verbal & written communication skills, able to work collaboratively with manager and across different teams

· Creative and analytical thinker and active listener, capable of generating innovative ideas for digital marketing campaigns

· Ability to manage and prioritize multiple ongoing projects and weekly tasks, provide support and offer input to help meet project goals.

**Why work for Cambridge Innovation Institute?**

CII is the most resilient, progressive, growing, open-minded and friendly company in the conference business! Our environment is inclusive and very fast-paced, and our staff are tight-knit and tremendously dedicated. We believe employees should be recognized and rewarded for superior effort...and superior effort abounds! We actively promote training and career development at all levels of experience and responsibility. We are committed to work/life balance, offering flexible scheduling, generous paid leave, and employee wellness programs. Other pluses:

· Excellent pay and incentives, including company profit share

· Health and dental insurance and FSA plan

· 401(k) with matching company contributions

· Company-paid life insurance and disability insurance

**CII Celebrates Diversity!** We welcome all qualified applicants without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, disability, status as a protected veteran, or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state, or local law.

About **Cambridge Innovation Institute** (https://www.cambridgeinnovationinstitute.com/)

CII delivers cutting-edge information through conferences, publications and training to forward-thinking leaders, innovators, and senior executives from life science, technology, and energy industries. We focus on high-technology fields where research and development are essential for the advancement of innovation. Please visit our website for more detail.

We look forward to hearing from you!

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $56,000.00 - $59,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* Dental insurance
* Employee assistance program
* Employee discount
* Flexible schedule
