Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

Work Location: Remote

title: Digital Marketing Specialist
description:
**Company Information**Global TekMed Holdings is a conglomerate of industry-leading businesses spanning multiple markets, including Sales, Marketing,
IT, Management, Accounting, and more. Our primary focus is creating B2B and B2C products and services supporting the military veteran community.
At Global TekMed, you will have the opportunity to work in a collaborative environment with high growth opportunities. We are looking for a talented digital marketer to generate high-converting content and campaigns across multiple brands that support the military Veteran community. Come be a part of something great!
**Position Overview**
The Digital Marketing Specialist is a full-time position within our Marketing Department. This position is responsible for creating and executing the team’s email marketing, basic graphic design, updating websites, social media, copywriting, video content, and more. The role requires someone self-motivated and detail-oriented with an innovative attitude and can balance several tasks to help enhance our digital marketing platforms as a vital communication tool for our customers. Having an understanding or having previous marketing experience within the military and Veterans demographic is a plus.
This position will report to the Senior Marketing Specialist and the candidate will adhere to the team’s brand strategy and guidelines when developing content for all digital platforms and assisting in the management of assigned digital media responsibilities.
Applicants must include a link or documents that highlight some of their experience.
**Locations:** Remote US Only (Candidates must reside within the US)
**Job Type:** Full-time (40 hours per week). May require additional hours, evenings, and/or weekend work.  


**Essential Functions**
* Collaborate with marketing and leadership to deliver key business goals through web and graphic content (including graphic design, digital marketing promotions, lead generation efforts, and generating marketing qualified leads), digital marketing, and internal communications.
* Create and support campaigns executed through marketing platforms with multichannel tactics, including emails, SMS, social, and other digital channels.
* Write and edit content for multichannel distribution, including website, email, print, social, digital signage, video, and more. Produce relevant content that adheres to brand standards and messaging guidelines and can utilize our AI content development tools. Content development includes some of the following:
* Produce and develop email communication design and content, tracking, and follow-up reporting in SendGrid.
* Produce content for social media sites including Facebook, Instagram, YouTube, etc.
* Graphic Design – Use Adobe Creative Suite or Canva to generate digital banner ads and imagery aligned with brand style guidelines.
* Copywriting – Write preliminary website, social, and email marketing content to promote brand awareness and calls to action that align with customer values.
* Other duties as assigned.

**Work Experience**
* Minimum of 2-3 years of experience working directly for a brand or within an agency.
* Must be self-directed, detail-oriented, and can organize and schedule work effectively to meet deadlines.
* Ability to communicate effectively across all departments and externally.
* Ability to work both independently and the desire to learn more as we grow.
* Ability to multitask and re-prioritize assignments appropriately, while maintaining an ability to juggle numerous projects simultaneously.
* Photography or video experience a plus
* A basic understanding of Adobe Creative Suite or Canva is preferred.
* Immersed in social networks (Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, YouTube, and others)
* Strong visual eye for social media graphics, photography, videos, copy, etc.
* Strong understanding of social media best practices and social platforms
* Intense passion for helping us grow digital marketing aspects of the business.
* Strong attention to detail, grammar, and proofreading skills.
* A proactive attitude and strong time management skills delivering to meet deadlines.
* Solutions-oriented approach to work and possesses a strong willingness to venture into the unknown, experiment, and work collaboratively.
* Customer services skills


**Preferred Qualifications**
* Experience with SendGrid, Canva, Jasper AI, Adobe, and other digital marketing platforms.
* A degree in marketing, communications, or graphic design, is preferred but not required.
* Veterans and Military experience are also welcome.
* An understanding of military culture and language, vocabulary, and jargon used to market to Veterans is a bonus.


**Benefits**
401(k) Plan
Medical Insurance
Private Gym
Paid Holidays
Paid Time off
*Global TekMed Holdings is an equal-opportunity employer. All applicants will be considered for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, marital status, veteran status, or any other applicable legally protected status or characteristic.*

title: Customer Service (Phone/Chat/Email) for Ed Tech Company
description:
**About Us**

We are an educational website for students from elementary to high school seeking highly motivated and enthusiastic individuals to join our team!

This position includes customer service responsibilities such as online live chat, answering emails and phone calls, and responding to customers on social media. As a remote worker, you will need to be independent and self-motivated, holding yourself accountable for tasks and ongoing responsibilities with little supervision.

**Who You Are**

The ideal candidate will be tech-savvy, a quick learner, attentive to detail, and have problem-solving and critical-thinking skills. You should also have excellent interpersonal and communication skills, especially written, as well as reliable high-speed internet and a typing speed of at least 45 words per minute.

**We're in need of individuals who shine in customer service interactions!** Your role will frequently involve assisting parents via phone conversations, and on some days, you might find yourself working on the phone for the majority of your shift.

We are looking for someone proactive, trustworthy, empathetic, and patient, with the ability to handle difficult customer situations and turn a negative experience into a positive one. You should be skilled in written and verbal communication and able to work well with the internal organization (team) and external customers.

In addition to customer service, this position offers many opportunities for growth in other areas of the company.

This is a **full-time position**, offering a pay rate of $19.00 - $23.00 per hour, with paid time off and the ability to work from home. We encourage job seekers of all ages and education levels to apply, including those with gaps in their resume.

This is a **fully remote** position, however, applicants must reside in and be able to legally work in the **United States.**

**Schedule:** Open schedules include Monday-Friday 3:00 PM - 11:00 PM Eastern (12:00 PM - 8:00 PM Pacific) and weekends 12:00 PM - 8:00 PM Eastern (9:00 AM - 5:00 PM Pacific). Revolving evenings, nights, and weekends availability is needed due to an increase in staffed hours. Morning shifts are full, but candidates may have the opportunity to grow into these shifts as they earn seniority.

**Benefits:** We offer health, dental, and vision insurance for all full-time employees! Our health insurance will also include specialty care like fertility benefits and chiropractic care. We want our employees to have the care and support they need.

**We're Growing!:** Our student base is growing rapidly and we are currently hiring for multiple positions across several departments! Our expansion stems from two key factors: our commitment to providing exceptional educational content to our students by scaling our team with passionate individuals, and our pursuit of new opportunities to enhance our students' learning experiences by broadening our capabilities and expertise as an organization.

You can hear our CEO, Johannes Ziegler, discuss our company in this podcast: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=7mabdbqbSco&t=23s&ab\\_channel=Universit%C3%A4tStuttgart.

If you think this role describes you, we would love to hear from you. Apply now to join our team!

Pay: $19.00 - $23.00 per hour

Expected hours: 40 per week

Benefits:

* 401(k)

* Dental insurance
* Flexible schedule
* Health insurance

* Vision insurance
* Work from home

* 1 year

* Day shift
* Evening shift

* Monday to Friday
* Weekends as needed

* Remote

title: Paid Search Specialist
description:
**About this role**



The Paid Search Specialist position is crucial to our advertising and marketing team. In this role, you will help customers grow and acquire more clients through highly targeted PPC campaigns in Google Ads. You will regularly monitor and help optimize the performance of campaigns for multiple corporate clients and independent veterinary hospital owners. Additionally, you will help implement new strategies to bring our clients the best campaign performance and experience possible.


**Apply if you're excited to:**


* Strategize, develop and maintain multiple Google Ad campaigns for veterinary hospitals and clinics
* Monitor and report on the performance of campaigns as they relate to customer goals and conversions
* Communicate via phone, Zoom, or email with customers, advising on how to grow their business and improve ROI through digital advertising
* Assist in the development, implementation, and QA of Google Ad Campaigns and assets


**About You**


* 1+ years of experience managing and optimizing multiple digital marketing campaigns at once
* Proficient with Hubspot, Salesforce, Trello, or other project management software
* Demonstrable history of tracking, analyzing, and reporting on ad campaign performance
* Customer service mentality: proactive and comfortable speaking with customers and defusing escalations as necessary
* Ability to monitor trends and use data to drive effective decision-making
* Thrives in a fast-paced, high-growth environment with a high level of drive, accountability, and attention to detail
* Proven ability to work with other functional areas to achieve company-wide success in meeting objectives
* Google Ad, Google Analytics, and Google Tag Manager certifications are a plus!

**Benefits & Perks:**  

PetDesk is a remote organization focused on a culture, infrastructure, and ecosystem that supports team members' participation in critical decisions and information sharing, regardless of location. Benefits and perks include:
* Medical coverage for employees and dependents (80-90% covered by employer)
* Employer HSA contribution with HDHP
* 401(k) match up to 3.5%
* Dependent Care Flexible Spending Account (FSA)
* Dental & Vision coverage available
* Basic Life and AD&D Insurance
* Short and Long Term Disability
* 13 Paid Annual Holidays
* Paid Parental Leave
* Pawternity Leave, Financial Pet Adoption Support & Subsidized Pet Insurance
* $250 Annual Stipend for Learning and Development

**Pay Range**


$26—$32 USD
Petvisor is the parent company of a family of brands that includes PetDesk, Vetstoria, WhiskerCloud, Kontak, and Groomer.io. Petvisor equips veterinary practices and pet services businesses with a suite of mobile-enabled tools, facilitating better communication, service, and client retention. The company's innovative approach supports over 10,000 veterinary clinics, 400 grooming facilities, and over 20 million pet parents globally.



We are an equal opportunity and strive for a culture where everyone feels empowered to celebrate their whole, authentic selves at work. We encourage varied approaches and points of view to cultivate an inclusive workplace where difference is valued. Diversity fuels innovation and strengthens our bond with our customers and the communities we serve.


Our recruiting process is rooted in "Who: The A Method of Hiring" and consists of an average 2-week hiring timeline. This standardized interview process allows candidates to answer the same questions, experience the same process, and ensure a fair performance review from multiple perspectives.



Please, no external recruiters—candidate profiles submitted from external recruiting agencies will not be considered.


**Notice at Collection to Applicants Residing in California**  

Depending on your location, the California Consumer Privacy Act (CCPA) may regulate how we manage job applicants' data. Our full notice outlining how your data will be processed as part of the application procedure for application locations is available at this link. By submitting your application, you agree to our use and processing of your data as required.

title: Digital Content Specialist
description:
**About Us:**


Blue Mountain, a pioneer in Life Sciences Asset Management for over 30 years, holds a unique position in the industry with a proven legacy. Founded in 1989, Blue Mountain offers a comprehensive, integrated solution, assisting numerous Pharmaceutical, Biotech, Cell and Gene Therapy, Medical Device, and Contract Manufacturing companies. From initial set-up to installation, from training to validation, our company empowers life sciences companies to excel in GMP asset management by implementing our best-in-class software. This enables them to harness the power of the cloud, embrace paperless processes, and ensure strict regulatory compliance.


Blue Mountain's ultimate mission is to support regulated companies in introducing new, safe, and effective therapies to the market. Achieving this requires intricate processes and products that adhere to the highest industry standards.

**Digital Content Specialist:**

Are you a creative and ambitious individual eager to advance your career as a Digital Content Specialist in a growing tech company? We are seeking a dynamic and results-driven professional with 2-5years of marketing experience to join our team and lead our digital content strategy. This role offers a unique opportunity to make a significant impact in a fast-paced B2B SaaS environment within the Life Sciences industry.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Collaborate with subject matter experts (SMEs) to create and update marketing collateral, including but not limited to eBooks, blog posts, whitepapers, case studies, webinar slide decks, and infographics that target specific buyer personas and address pain points.
* Conduct keyword research, on-page SEO, and monitor organic search rankings to optimize website content for search engines.
* Create visually appealing content, such as graphics, infographics, and presentations, to enhance marketing materials.
* Develop and execute compelling social media content strategies to fuel demand generation campaigns and engage with our audience across various platforms.
* Assist in the creation and execution of email marketing campaigns, including writing compelling email copy and monitoring campaign performance.
* Embrace and scale the transformative power of AI tools in content creation, exploring innovative ways to leverage artificial intelligence for improved content quality and efficiency
* Analyze marketing data to evaluate the effectiveness of campaigns and make data-driven recommendations for improvements.
* Stay current with industry trends, competitor activity, and best practices in digital content marketing.

**Who You Are:**

* A proactive marketer who continuously seeks new, innovative ways to level up their marketing approach and delivery.
* An adventurous marketer, demonstrating a "can-do" spirit, and a strong desire for continuous learning and professional development
* Possesses a sharp design sense and adeptly utilizes tools such as Canva to craft visually captivating content that engages the audience.
* Basic understanding of SEO principles and digital marketing concepts.
* Familiarity with marketing tools and platforms such as HubSpot, WordPress, and Google Analytics.
* Ability to work both independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment.
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
* Attention to detail and strong organizational skills.


If you are a passionate and creative digital content specialist with 2-5 years of marketing experience ready to make a difference, we encourage you to apply and help drive our marketing efforts to new heights.

title: Paid Ad Specialist
company: Ignite on Purpose, subsidiary of Share on Purpose, Inc.

Ignite On Purpose was created to serve founder-led businesses that want to grow faster and positively impact their community. title: Digital Marketing Specialist (Email & SMS)
description:
**About SSBD:**

At Single Source Beverage Distribution (SSBD), our commitment to innovation extends beyond the ordinary, providing beverage brands with a comprehensive solution that combines efficiency and technological prowess. Our suite of production, distribution, and marketing services enable beverage brands we create and partner with to excel in their vertical against the competition. We’re a team of passionate individuals who thrive in a creative, collaborative, and high-energy environment. If you’re looking for a workplace that values innovation, fosters growth, and enables you to make a tangible impact, then you might just be the Digital Marketing Specialist we’re looking for.

**Job Description:**

As a Digital Marketing Specialist you will play a critical role in developing and executing comprehensive digital marketing campaigns to drive customer acquisition, engagement, and retention.

We are looking for a T-shaped marketer who possesses both broad knowledge across various disciplines and deep expertise in the areas of Email and SMS marketing.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* **Email Marketing:**
* - Develop and execute targeted email marketing campaigns to nurture leads, promote products, drive conversions, and grow our subscription program.
* - Segment email lists and personalize messaging to deliver relevant content to different audience segments.
* - Monitor email performance metrics and conduct A/B testing to optimize campaign effectiveness.
* **SMS Marketing:**
* - Plan and execute SMS marketing campaigns to engage customers, promote special offers, drive sales and subscriptions.
* - Ensure compliance with SMS marketing regulations and best practices.
* - Analyze SMS campaign performance and iterate on messaging to improve results.

**Subscription Management:**- Collaborate with the Director of eCommerce, DTC and eCommerce Manager to develop and execute on strategies to grow our subscription programs by increasing sign-ups, AOV, and retention rates.- Collaborate with cross-functional teams to enhance the subscription experience and address customer feedback.- Analyze subscription metrics to identify opportunities for growth and optimization.  
\\*

* **Stay Current:** Stay abreast of industry trends, emerging technologies, and competitive landscape to identify opportunities for innovation and maintain a competitive edge in the market.

**Qualifications:**

* Bachelor's degree in Marketing, Communications, or a related field.
* 3+ years of experience in digital marketing, with a focus on executing eCommerce Email and SMS programs is a must.
* Broad knowledge across various marketing disciplines desired.
* Proven track record of driving results through digital marketing campaigns.
* Strong analytical skills and proficiency in interpreting data to optimize campaign performance.
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
* Experience with Klaviyo is required.
* Experience with BigCommerce, Shopify, Recharge and GA4 is preferred.
* Ability to manage multiple projects and prioritize tasks effectively.
* Knowledge of ecommerce industry trends and best practices.
* Experience with subscription-based business models is a plus.

If you're a versatile digital marketer with a passion for driving results across multiple channels with a focus on Email and SMS, we want to hear from you. Join us at SSBD and play a key role in shaping our digital marketing strategies. Apply now with your resume and portfolio showcasing your relevant experience and achievements.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $70,000.00 - $80,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* Paid time off

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

Experience:

* Email marketing: 3 years (Required)
* SMS marketing: 3 years (Required)
* Klaviyo: 2 years (Required)
* BigCommerce: 1 year (Preferred)
* E-commerce: 3 years (Required)

Work Location: Remote

title: Paid Media Specialist
description:
**Job Summary**

The Account Manager is a member of the Senior Healthcare Direct Marketing department reporting to the VP, marketing. The Account Manager will be responsible for the creation and execution of the daily lead plan and serve as a key liaison between the Marketing and Sales departments.

The Account Manager will manage relationships with lead partners to determine which calls to acquire and deliver optimal financial results. They’ll utilize internal and external systems and platforms to track results and make adjustments throughout the day to deliver on the plan.

title: Customer Support Specialist - LollyLaw
description:
Paradigm is a legal-industry leader in cloud-based software with three practice management platforms – PracticePanther, Bill4Time, and MerusCase – as well as epayments (Headnote) and accounting (TrustBooks) solutions.

**What is the role?**

We have a reputation for excellent customer service. As a LollyLaw Customer Support Specialist, you will act as a client advocate to ensure that our customers are able to achieve positive business outcomes throughout their partnership with LollyLaw. Proactive, energetic, and self-driven, you will strive to understand our customers within the legal tech industry and work to be a trusted partner so that firms love and grow with LollyLaw.


**In this role, you will:**

* Support existing customers via email and phone
* Diagnose & troubleshoot client issues
* Onboard new customers with training calls and check-ins
* Continuously acquire expertise in LollyLaw features
* Write and update help center materials
* Improve client retention
* Work with various stakeholders to help them understand evolving client needs
* Other duties as assigned


**Qualifications**

* 1-2 years of customer support experience
* SaaS experience preferred
* Strong initiative and creative problem solving
* Strong communication skills and introspection to understand customer needs
* Able to work well with a team and independently
* Excellent conflict management skills
* Experience in the legal or consulting industry advantageous


**Who is the ideal candidate?**

* You are a problem-solver and a go-getter who isn't afraid to dive into projects and get your hands dirty
* You articulate clearly, both written and orally, to build consensus, communicate ideas and deliver on-time
* Ability to engage, influence and inspire stakeholders to drive collaboration and alignment.
* Excellent with user-experience design principles and data analytics


**Why should you join Paradigm?**



Paradigm offers a suite of legal practice software solutions that help lawyers manage, automate and grow their firms. More than 50,000 lawyers across 170 countries use our products to shift the paradigm of how they practice law. With four world-class all-in-one legal practice management platforms — PracticePanther, Bill4Time, MerusCase and LollyLaw – in addition to payments and accounting solutions powered by Headnote and TrustBooks.



Paradigm empowers lawyers across the spectrum of practice area, geography, and business needs. At Paradigm, we are fast-paced, ambitious and unified by a common vision to build the best legal technology products in the world.

  

**Benefits/Perks**

  

* Competitive salary
* Paid vacation + sick and parental leave
* Remote working flexibility
* Budget for home office improvements
* Company culture that encourages work / life balance
* 100% paid PPO medical, vision, and dental insurance, 401k matching, equity grants
* Bi-annual company retreats and many other fun activities to bring our team together (physically or virtually) as often as possible!

### **About Paradigm**



Paradigm is a rapidly growing legal technology business that offers a suite of product solutions to allow lawyers to automate their firms, get more done in less time, and focus on what they do best: practicing law. The business currently includes three leading practice management and online payment and accounting solutions – PracticePanther, Bill4Time, Headnote, Trustbooks and MerusCase.



Paradigm operates as a single business and team with multiple software solutions. Our software offerings have the ability to scale in different niches of the market, and the shared resources, talent, and expertise allow us to accelerate growth across the portfolio. Paradigm will continue to grow each of these platforms organically, while also looking for new acquisitions that can bolster our position as a leading legal technology company. Paradigm has ~100 employees based in New York, Florida, Washington, California, and other locations across the US.

title: Digital Marketing Specialist
description:
**About Appriss Retail**


Appriss Retail provides real-time decisions and active risk monitoring to enable our customers to maximize profitability while managing risk. Our solutions are continually adapting to changing market conditions.


We bring 20+ years of retail data science expertise and experience. We serve a global base of leading commerce partners, representing 1/3 of all US omnichannel retail sales activity across 150,000 retail locations across specialty, apparel, department store, hard goods, big box, grocery, pharmacy, and hospitality businesses in 45 countries on six continents.


The company provides compelling, relevant, and profitable collective intelligence to operations, finance, marketing, and loss prevention. Appriss Retail’s performance-improvement solutions yield measurable results with significant return on investment.

**About the role**


The Digital Marketing Specialist is an integral member of Appriss Retail’s marketing team, helping to develop, execute, and maintain the company’s digital marketing campaigns. The ideal candidate will have a strong creative background, using Canva to create assets for email campaigns, ads, landing pages, and events. The Digital Marketing Specialist will be responsible for managing our email campaigns, including monthly digests, campaign emails, product-related emails, and event emails. The Specialist will also work closely with subject matter experts to create engaging blog content that is optimized for search engines and helps reinforce Appriss Retail’s position as an industry leader in retail fraud and abuse prevention.**What you'll do**

* Create and schedule posts in HubSpot for our social media channels that are engaging and offer a unique mix of topics and content, with the intent of increasing engagement, followers, and MQLs.
* Create and schedule emails in HubSpot for marketing campaigns, digests, product updates, and events.
* Work alongside our agency to publish two blogs a month, including topic research, building an outline with SMEs, SEO keyword research, finalizing the blog, photo selection, publishing it on our website, and creating social media posts and emails to promote them.
* Use strong creative skills to design images and videos for emails, landing pages, events, and organic and paid social media.
* Assist in writing content for the Appriss Retail blog, emails, and social media.
* Assist in editing the website in WordPress.
* Collaborate with other departments and stakeholders to ensure alignment and integration of digital marketing efforts with overall business objectives and brand identity.

**Qualifications**

* 1-3 years of experience building comprehensive digital marketing campaigns using a CMS or marketing automation platform (HubSpot preferred).
* Strong creative skills (Canva or Photoshop preferred) for creating branded social media posts, ad campaigns, and videos.
* Strong understanding of social media platforms, particularly LinkedIn.
* Strong content writing skills.
* Excellent writing and communication skills.
* Working knowledge of email, landing page, and website design best practices.
* Working knowledge of WordPress and Salesforce.
* Working knowledge of email marketing best practices and CAN-SPAM compliance.
* Must be able to work independently and within a team.
* Skilled in PowerPoint.
* Basic knowledge of HTML.
* Up-to-date with the latest trends and best practices in SEO.

**Physical Demands -**Sedentary **Benefits**  

Appriss Retail offers competitive benefits including medical, dental, and vision coverage. We offer an immediate vesting 401(k) plan with employer matching, unlimited paid time off for salaried employees, and well-being support including gym reimbursements, a subscription to Calm – Meditation and Sleep app, and paid leave for new parents and family care. As a hybrid global community, we also offer a remote work-first environment empowering our people to work wherever suits their lifestyle.
The pay range for this role is:
55,000 - 65,000 USD per year (Remote - United States)

title: Marketing Specialist
description:
**Job Description Summary**
===========================


Executes standard marketing tasks to support product marketing priorities for Verisound Digital & AI ultrasound Solutions.  

  

GE HealthCare is a leading global medical technology and digital solutions innovator. Our purpose is to create a world where healthcare has no limits. Unlock your ambition, turn ideas into world-changing realities, and join an organization where every voice makes a difference, and every difference builds a healthier world.**Job Description**
===================

**Roles and Responsibilities**
==============================

* Basic understanding of key business drivers; uses this understanding to accomplish own work. Good understanding of how work of own team integrates with other teams and contributes to the area.

For customer facing roles, develops strong customer relationships and serves as the interface between customer and GEHC. Explains technical information to others.

===========================

* Exceptional drive and creativity.
* High energy works proactively and demonstrates flexibility in approach to changing work priorities.

We expect all employees to live and breathe our behaviors: to act with humility and build trust, lead with transparency, deliver with focus and drive ownership – always with unyielding integrity.


Our total rewards are designed to unlock your ambition by giving you the boost and flexibility you need to turn your ideas into world-changing realities. Our salary and benefits are everything you’d expect from an organization with global strength and scale, and you’ll be surrounded by career opportunities in a culture that fosters care, collaboration and support.


#LI-PH1 #LI-Remote


For U.S. based positions only, the pay range for this position is $67,760.00-$101,640.00 Annual. The specific compensation offered to a candidate may be influenced by a variety of factors including skills, qualifications, experience and location. ==========================


GE HealthCare offers a great work environment, professional development, challenging careers, and competitive compensation. GE HealthCare is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.


GE HealthCare will only employ those who are legally authorized to work in the United States for this opening. Any offer of employment is conditioned upon the successful completion of a drug screen (as applicable).


While GE HealthCare does not currently require U.S. employees to be vaccinated against COVID-19, some GE HealthCare customers have vaccination mandates that may apply to certain GE HealthCare employees.

title: Digital Marketing Strategist - REMOTE
description:
Zero Gravity Marketing (ZGM) is looking for a passionate, data-driven, and proactive Digital Marketing Strategist to join their Strategy Team. This role will report directly to the Director of Strategy.
The Omnichannel Strategy Team drives the overarching strategy and execution of digital channels across our eCommerce and lead generation accounts. This resource will lead the SEO, PPC/Paid Social, Email/SMS, UX, and Social Media teams to develop full-funnel, multi-channel strategies and ensure client success. They will also be very data-driven, diving into both native and cross-channel reporting tools such as Google Analytics to inform pivots based on performances and insights.


Working alongside an Account Executive, the Digital Marketing Strategist will lead client calls and review any resulting executions as the last line before sending to the client. This resource must be able to dig into the data, find insights, and drive any resulting pivots across channels with relevant resources.


Responsibilities:

* Work with different departments to conduct audits and build multi-channel marketing plans
* Work with a strategist from relevant teams, the Digital Marketing Strategist may assist those teams by doing:
	+ PPC:
		- Occasionally write ad copy
		- Pull together ad graphic direction
		- Dive into Facebook Ads Manager, AdWords, and Google Analytics to review ongoing performance and drive pivots
	+ SEO:
		- Review ongoing performance and pull insights from SEO to PPC strategy
		- Assist with content topics and keyword recommendations
	+ UX:
		- Analyze on-site performance and make recommendations for website edits and optimizations to improve user experience across devices
		- Provide relevant edits to the site for individual promotional or product launch support
		- Provide clear wireframes of site edits and recommendations
	+ Conversion Rate Optimization (CRO)
		- Interpret data from all sources to analyze the effectiveness of current strategies
		- Product/service merchandising recommendations for on-site pages
		- Provide data-backed website recommendations for landing pages, split testing, creative asset, and/or calls-to-action to optimize the customer journey and support conversion goals
	+ Content & Creative
		- Provide direction and recommendations for visual content with channel best practices in mind
		- Share recommendations for cross-channel content rollout and distribution plans through digital channels
* Work alongside our client team to further define holistic brand messaging and storytelling angles for consumer audiences to support marketing efforts
* Ideate and plan marketing and/or promotional calendars
* Define and refine target audiences
* Leading & managing multi-channel campaigns across departments
* Stays on top of industry trends within digital marketing and the consumer space


Requirements:

* 1-3 years of direct executional experience in at least one of the following channels: PPC/Paid Social, Email, or SEO. Multi-channel experience is highly preferred.
* Proven experience in launching integrated and impactful digital marketing campaigns with measured outcomes
* Expertise in customer segmentation and digital marketing
* Strong analytical mindset and proven reporting experience
* Strong project management, communication, and time management skills
* Demonstrable experience of creating multi-channel strategies (digital preferred)
* Excellent interpersonal and communication skills with the ability to collaborate and influence others
* Google Analytics Certification highly preferred
* Ability to multitask is crucial. Must be able to work with several different teams and with projects of varying priorities
* Not required, but experience with customer loyalty, referral or review platforms is considered a plus

  

Why join Zero Gravity Marketing?

* Competitive pay & time off policies
* 401k with Employer contribution
* Remote position
* Educational Opportunities
* Medical, Dental, & Vision benefits offered
* Summer Fridays!
* WFH stipend
* DEI committee

title: Digital Marketing Coordinator
description:
Hal Leonard is seeking a highly motivated and creative Digital Marketing Coordinator to join our direct-to-consumer marketing team.

This entry-level position will play a crucial role in supporting two leading eCommerce brands, Sheet Music Direct and Sheet Music Plus, focusing on email marketing, social media management, and blog content creation. The ideal candidate will be a musician or have a musical background, which will resonate with our audience and enrich our content’s authenticity and engagement.

**Why Join Us?**

Hal Leonard offers a dynamic work environment where creativity and passion for music are valued and nurtured. We provide opportunities for professional growth and learning, aiming to foster the talents of each member of our team. By joining us, you will be part of a company that is making a significant impact on the music community and industry.

**Key Responsibilities**

* **Email Marketing:** Assist in the creation and execution of email marketing campaigns, including newsletter design, distribution, and performance analysis.
* **Social Media Management:** Support the management of our social media profiles, including content creation, scheduling posts, engaging with followers, and monitoring social media trends to optimize our presence. Knowledge and experience with TikTok is desirable.
* **Blog Content Creation:** Contribute to our blog by writing engaging and informative articles that appeal to our target audience, driving traffic and engagement to our websites.
* **Analytics and Reporting:** Monitor and report on the performance of digital marketing activities, providing insights and recommendations for improvement.
* **Collaboration:** Work closely with the direct-to-consumer marketing team and other departments to ensure a cohesive and effective marketing strategy that aligns with Sheet Music Direct’s and Sheet Music Plus’ goals and objectives.

**Qualifications Required**

* Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Communications, Music, or a related field
* Strong interest in digital marketing and social media trends
* Excellent writing, editing, and communication skills
* Ability to work independently and as part of a team in a fast-paced environment
* Creative thinker with attention to detail
* Experience using visual editing tools (Adobe CS, Canva, etc.)
* Basic knowledge of email marketing tools (experience with Bloomreach is a plus).
* Musicianship or a background in music

**How to Apply:** If this description piques your interest and fits your skill set, please send your résumé, cover letter, and any relevant work samples or portfolio links to us by applying on Indeed.

Hal Leonard is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.

Job Type: Full-time

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Dental insurance
* Flexible schedule
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Parental leave
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* Day shift
* Monday to Friday

Application Question(s):

* Please let us know your salary expectation for this role
* Tell us about your musical background and how it aligns with this role

title: Account Based Marketing Manager (ABM)
description:
We are looking for a talented (Senior) Account Based Marketing (ABM) Specialist who is responsible for leading the identification, development, implementation, management, and measurement of ABM in target accounts to drive pipeline, accelerate sales, and build revenue within those accounts. You will act as a liaison between the Marketing, SDR, and Sales Teams to develop strategies and tactics designed to penetrate targeted accounts. **Responsibilities:**
Work with Sales, Portfolio Marketing, and within our ABM tools to identify meaningful accounts to target with an ABM strategy
Develop custom messaging and engagement plans in targeted ABM accounts
Execute innovative and creative ABM programs across channels to generate a pipeline from concept through execution (strategy, timeline, budget, design and content support, campaign development, and campaign measurement)
Gather and coordinate analytics across various platforms (Demandbase, SFDC, Marketo, Outreach, Google) and with teams like Sales, Customer Success, SDRs, and others to gather account insights
Work with Marketing Operations and Sales to ensure campaigns are targeted to the right people and that we have the right contacts in the database
Provide ongoing data and insights that measure, analyze, and report on ABM target account penetration on a monthly, and quarterly basis as well as impact of ABM efforts on sales pipeline revenue (marketing sourced and influenced)
Develop and provide ongoing Sales communication to ensure alignment, collaboration, and follow up on ABM leads
Manage the ABM tools and tech stack including Demandbase, Sales Intelligence Elite, and others
Help promote ABM across our business by documenting and sharing best practices, driving successful campaigns, and supporting and optimizing our ABM infrastructure **Requirements:**
Minimum of 10 years of marketing experience in digital marketing, demand generation and/or ABM preferably in high-tech B2B SaaS
ABM experience in Education industry or Ed Tech moves you to the top of the list
Strong project management, organization, and time management skills required
Strong interpersonal and communication skills; ability to develop productive working relationships with Marketing, Sales, and CxO
Excellent attention to detail, ability to self-manage, problem-solving skills required
Strong willingness to test, optimize, and improve ABM programs
Experience executing innovative multi-channel marketing programs for enterprise accounts
Experience with account targeting and segmentation
Strong reporting capabilities and the ability to provide insights and analyze ABM programs
Familiarity with B2B SaaS sales cycles and how to employ marketing strategies to nurture leads and drive engagement
High proficiency across major marketing technologies, including SFDC, Marketo, Demandbase, Sendoso, Outreach
Bachelor's degree in marketing, business, or comparable education/experience **Perks & Benefits:**
Competitive salary, equity and 401k
Medical, dental, disability, and life insurance benefits
HSA program, vision, voluntary life, and AD&D
Tuition reimbursement
Paid time off, 10 paid holidays, and flexible work schedules
Lifestyle spending account

title: Digital Marketing Specialist
description:
**About Xamtac**

Xamtac is an AI Marketing Ecosystem for Strategies, Asset & Data Organization & Launching Campaigns Across Platforms

https://www.xamtac.com/dashboard

Xamtac, originally established as a digital marketing agency in Chicago, has evolved significantly from its roots. The company's journey began with the development of internal tools designed to enhance the marketing capabilities of its clients. Recognizing the potential of these tools, Xamtac expanded its vision, transforming these proprietary solutions into a marketable product. This strategic shift enabled the company to offer its innovative platform to a broader audience, providing businesses of various sizes and sectors with access to its advanced marketing ecosystem.

Today, Xamtac stands as a testament to the power of adaptive technology in marketing, offering solutions that are not just effective but also intuitively aligned with the evolving needs of the digital world.

**Job Description:**

Join Xamtac Consulting, a premier digital marketing agency, as a Digital Marketing Specialist. This role is ideal for an experienced professional who thrives in an individual contributor capacity, directly influencing the success of our clients' digital marketing initiatives.

**Responsibilities:**

* Strategically manage and optimize comprehensive Google ad campaigns, including Search, Shopping Ads and Performance Max.
* Conduct detailed market research to develop targeted strategies.
* Independently analyze campaign data, identifying trends and making data-driven decisions.
* Execute A/B testing for continuous campaign improvement.
* Coordinate with teams for content and design needs, maintaining autonomy in strategy and execution.
* Offer strategic insights to clients, enhancing their digital marketing effectiveness.
* Stay updated on digital marketing innovations, integrating new strategies and tools.

**Requirements:**

* Minimum 3–5 years in digital marketing with a focus on Google ad campaigns.
* Strong track record in an individual contributor role, managing complex digital projects.
* Expertise in analytics and digital marketing tools.
* Exceptional problem-solving and analytical skills.
* Effective communication, capable of client-facing interactions.
* Preferred: Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Business, or related field.

**What We Offer:**

* An autonomous role with a significant impact on client success.
* Exposure to a variety of industries and marketing challenges.
* A collaborative environment with opportunities for professional growth.
* Competitive salary and benefits package.

**Note:** This role offers the flexibility of working remotely and must be able to work in the Central Standard Time (CST) zone. If you are interested in the position, please apply or submit your detailed resume and a cover letter highlighting your relevant experience and achievements to karthik@xamtac.com

Expected Start Date: 08/01/2024

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: From $5,000.00 per month

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday
* Night shift

Education:

* Bachelor's (Preferred)

Experience:

* Digital marketing: 2 years (Required)
* total work: 3 years (Preferred)

Work Location: Remote

Expected Start Date: 03/04/2024

title: Marketing Ops Specialist
description:
PandaDoc is seeking a Marketing Operations Specialist to join our growing Revenue Operations team to support our GTM organization. We are seeking a process-driven and detail-oriented self-starter with the ability to help drive operational excellence for our revenue organization. In this role, you will play a pivotal part in our campaign operations and data management initiatives, helping maintain data integrity, conduct quality assurance checks, provide documentation, and offer executional support for new marketing initiatives.


**In this role, you will:**
---------------------------


* Be part of the larger centralized Revenue Operations team, building and guiding our revenue engine for scale
* Maintain a clean and organized marketing database, improving data integrity and availability
* Create standard segments and target audiences for use in marketing communications
* Support the execution of marketing campaigns and essential marketing operations initiatives, including nurture workflows, lead scoring, deliverability, etc.
* Own the QA process for new campaigns, workflows, emails, forms, etc. to proactively address areas for improvement prior to campaign launch
* Use data insights to identify opportunities for optimization of existing campaigns
* Develop and maintain comprehensive documentation for MOPs resources and best practices

**About you:**
--------------


* 2-3 years of Marketing Operations experience in a scale-up SaaS company
* Proficiency in executing marketing operations concepts: workflow management, segmentation, reporting, and managing lead lifecycle
* Hands-on experience as a marketing automation platform architect or practitioner
* Previous involvement in building marketing technology stacks and integrating tools to align with business objectives
* Understanding of marketing data and privacy regulations
* Strong attention to detail and organizational skills, adept at balancing multiple projects and deliverables
* Excellent communication skills with the ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams to meet deadlines
* Proficient in Excel/Google Sheets, comfortable manipulating large sets of data

  


**The annual On-Target Earnings (OTE) salary range for this position is $60,000 - $70,000.**


**Benefits:**
-------------



Employees (and their families) may enroll in the company's medical, dental, vision, short & long term disability, life insurance, FSA and 401k plans. Employees will also receive 13.34+ hours of paid time off per month, 6 self care days, birthday PTO day, and 12 company paid holidays off per year. Employees may be able to purchase company stock (or receive annual bonuses).


**Company Overview:**
---------------------



PandaDoc empowers more than 50,000 growing organizations to thrive by taking the work out of document workflow. PandaDoc provides an all-in-one document workflow automation platform that helps fast scaling teams accelerate the ability to create, manage, and sign digital documents including proposals, quotes, contracts, and more. For more information, please visit https://www.pandadoc.com.


**Company Culture:**
--------------------



We're known for our work-life balance, kind co-workers, & creative virtual team-bonding events. And although our Pandas are located across the globe, we stay connected with the help of technology and ensure that everyone on our team feels, well, like a team.



Pandas work best when they're happy. We retain our talent by upholding our values of integrity & transparency, and selling a product that changes the lives of our customers.



Check out our LinkedIn to learn more.

  


**PandaDoc is an Equal Opportunity Employer.** We are committed to equal treatment of all employees without regard to race, national origin, religion, gender, age, sexual orientation, veteran status, physical or mental disability or other basis protected by law.

  


**EXTERNAL RECRUITERS**


**Approval Requirement**



The use of external recruiters/staffing agencies requires prior approval from our HR Team. The HR Team at PandaDoc requests that external recruiters/staffing agencies not to contact PandaDoc employees directly in an attempt to present candidates. Complying with this request will be a factor in determining future professional relationships with PandaDoc.


**Applications Deadline 3/29**

title: Search Engine Optimization (SEO) Specialist
description:
**About the Search Engine Optimization (SEO) Specialist position**

  

Design In DC is a digital agency built for the future. Over the past years, we have brought together an energetic and diverse team of experts who work in harmony to optimize every touch point of the user's website journey. It is clear that the future is digital which is why we are forward-thinking builders; design architects, and engineers that construct digital products and experiences for businesses and brands.


When you work with us, you get a global team driven by thinking, rethinking, and consumer insights as a means to change and disrupt. We bring together the best creative minds who use traditional methodologies to defy tradition. That is why we are a full-service agency with a unique and diverse arsenal of skills, from web design and development, to marketing and app development, to videography and animation. It is our mission to provide a solution to any question that you may ask. So let's build something for the future together.


Currently, we are actively searching for a highly skilled SEO Specialist to join our remote team. The ideal candidate should possess a substantial portfolio showcasing their expertise in the digital realm, acquired through freelance or agency positions.


**Key Responsibilities:**


* Conduct thorough keyword research, optimize website content, meta tags, and URLs.
* Perform website audits, collaborate with developers to resolve technical issues, monitor indexing, sitemaps, and crawl errors.
* Execute off-page SEO strategies, build high-quality backlinks through outreach and partnerships, monitor backlink profile.
* Utilize analytics tools to track website traffic, keyword rankings, and generate reports for optimization insights.


**Minimum Requirements:**


* At least 3 years of proven experience in both on-page and off-page SEO optimization.
* Strong understanding of SEO tools.
* Ability to analyze data and identify trends for optimization.
* Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
* Strong focus on achieving measurable results and meeting deadlines.


**To apply, please submit the following:**


* A comprehensive CV highlighting relevant skills and experience.


**What We Offer:**


* Fully remote work arrangement: Experience the convenience and flexibility of a fully remote work setup.
* Flexible schedule: Tailor your work hours to suit your personal needs and obligations.
* Supportive work environment: Join a team that fosters collaboration and offers a supportive atmosphere for your professional journey.

  

  

At Design in DC, we are committed to providing equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants, irrespective of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, genetics, sexual orientation, gender identity, or gender expression. We ensure gender equality in compensation and benefits, ensuring that individuals of all genders receive fair and equal treatment for comparable positions, duties, and conditions.

title: Digital Marketing Specialist
description:
*AssetWatch serves global manufacturers by powering manufacturing uptime through the delivery of an unparalleled condition monitoring experience, with a passion to care about the assets our customers care for every day. We are a devoted and capable team that includes world-renowned engineers and distinguished business leaders united by a common goal – To build the future of predictive maintenance. As we enter the next phase of rapid growth, we are seeking people to help lead the journey.*



We are seeking a motivated and savvy Digital Marketing Specialist to join our marketing team and generate MQLs that convert to revenue, primarily through strong social and SEM paid campaigns. The ideal candidate will be passionate about driving digital strategy and enhancing our online ad presence to achieve our marketing goals.


**What You'll Do:**

* With a strong customer focus, intimately learn the customer personas and markets and think creatively about the best ways to get in front of and engage with our target market.
* Develop and implement comprehensive digital marketing strategies and end-to-end campaigns to increase brand visibility and engagement across various digital platforms—including paid social media, email marketing, PPC and display ads, and other digital advertising tactics—all the way through the handoff to the BDR team to qualify or directly to demo. This includes developing retargeting and nurture campaigns to move leads through the funnel.
* Manage and optimize paid advertising campaigns on platforms such as Google AdWords, LinkedIn (and other social channels), ZoomInfo Marketing OS, and other relevant digital channels.
* Analyze digital marketing analytics reports and share insights with the team to develop optimization strategies.
* Collaborate with the content and creative to create high-quality content for various digital platforms and utilize existing content to adjust for different demand generation tactics.
* Develop lifecycle marketing nurtures and segmentation strategies.
* Leverage SEO keywords from webmaster to develop PPC strategies to drive web traffic and lead generation.
* Manage all paid social content, budget, and implementation.
* Coordinate with external agencies and vendors as needed to execute digital marketing campaigns.
* Stay up-to-date with digital marketing trends and potential new channels and strategies, including updates on social media marketing, attribution, and programmatic media


**Who You Are:**

* Bachelor's degree in Marketing, Communications, Business, or a related field or 3+ years of experience in B2B digital marketing, preferably within the industrial space.
* Experience with SEM, social media marketing, email marketing, and other digital marketing strategies.
* Proficiency in digital marketing tools and software, including Google Analytics, ZoomInfo Marketing OS, HubSpot, and LinkedIn.
* Excellent writing and story-telling skills.
* Strong communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively in a team environment.
* Creative thinker with a results-driven approach to problem-solving.
* Leverage data analytics to determine which tactics are working and which are not, and to optimize performance based on results. Look for ways to continuously improve the team's performance.
* Scrappy mentality with ability to work in a very fast-paced environment.


**What We Offer:**



AssetWatch is a remote-first rapidly growing startup providing a game changing condition monitoring platform and mobile experience in the industrial manufacturing space.


* Competitive compensation package including share options.
* Flexible work schedule
* Full benefits and 401K
* Opportunity to make a real impact every day
* Opportunity to work with an exciting and growing team
* Unlimited PTO


We have a distributed team that works remotely across locations in the United States. We are open to candidates from most states but collaboration within core working hours is required.

title: Distance Learning Digital Specialist (Remote)
description:
**Position Summary:**


This position requires understanding of online instruction and digital instructional design. Responsibilities include leveraging online education expertise to assist customers with the implementation of online science classes. As a subject matter expert (SME), developing new labs and investigations is imperative to assisting customers with lab design and course development.

 **Primary Responsibilities:**


1. Collaborate with the Distance Learning team to develop and recommend lab courses that support customers’ learning outcomes.


2. Create digital components for existing labs as supplements or replacements for lab course content.


3. Write, film, edit, and publish DL videos.


4. Create digital labs for missing content in product line.


5. Work closely with customers assisting with the implementation of online science courses. 6. Troubleshoot LTI integration issues with instructors or school’s LMS admin.


7. Manage DL content on CSO, and distribution of content to customers. Maintain records of virtual kit contents and virtual kits. Generate LTI codes and HTML passwords for virtual labs each semester.


8. Provide guidance and support to instructors as needed to ensure successful digital and hands-on lab experience for online students.


9. Performs Quality and User Acceptance Testing of new digital products.


10. Stays on top of digital trends in education including LMS and devices and identifies how Carolina can integrate with trends.


11. Develop a deep understanding of the college distance learning market.


12. Maintains relationships with educators, universities, and associations to enhance company credibility and identify new opportunities for the sales team.


13. Works with the Digital Manager and other stakeholders to evaluate and integrate digital resources for DL products.


14. Provide technical support for internal and external customers. Provide necessary tools, content, and training across departmental teams to ensure that customer touch points are consistent and impactful.

 **Secondary Responsibilities:**


1. Prepares for and attends appropriate industry events.


2. Performs other administrative duties as required.

 **Qualifications:**

**Education—**


Bachelor’s Degree in relevant field is required. Relevant fields include computer science, information systems, or instructional design. An additional degree in science or related content expertise is highly preferred.

 **Experience—**


3-5 years of experience with Microsoft Office suite, Adobe Acrobat and Premiere Rush, and web files (HTML, CSS, CSV, and JSON specifically) required. One year experience with Higher Ed LMS (Blackboard, Canvas, D2L, Moodle) required. Experience with LMS as an admin a plus. Agile development experience and leadership highly preferred. Articulate Storyline experience a plus.

 **Specialized Training/Skills/Certificates/Licenses—**


Project Management training/experience a plus. Ability to effectively plan, implement, and monitor self-directed and group projects. Must possess good written and oral communication skills. Strong content knowledge of subject area is necessary.

title: Email Marketing Specialist Remote R
description:
We are looking for a highly skilled and experienced professional to join our Petcube Team as the **Email Marketing Specialist**.


As the Email Marketing Specialist, you will develop and implement strategies to drive email marketing channel growth, increase sales, and spread awareness of the Petcube brand.

**Responsibilities**

* Develop and execute a comprehensive email marketing strategy.
* Manage and optimize email marketing tools, primarily focusing on Mailchimp and Sendgrid.
* Monitor KPIs, analyze campaign performance, and provide actionable insights for continuous improvement.
* Create engaging creative briefs for the design team, write strong copy, and come up with ideas for visually appealing content for email campaigns.
* Research email marketing trends, generate ideas, conduct continuous A/B tests, and experiment with various types of content.
* Collaborate with the marketing, product, design, sales, and customer support teams to ensure cohesive and integrated marketing efforts.
* Contribute to the company's growth plans by leveraging email marketing as a vital channel.

**Direct reporting** to the Brand Marketing Manager

**Key Requirements**

* 2+ years of proven experience in email marketing, with a focus on DTC e-commerce and a track record of successful campaigns and projects.
* Extensive experience with tools such as Mailchimp, Sendgrid, Figma, Mixpanel, Google Analytics, etc.
* Strong copywriting skills in English (C1 level) with the ability to create compelling content.
* Must love pets!

 **Will be a plus:**

* Experience with HTML.
* Solid understanding of marketing frameworks to retain, activate, and engage users.
* Background in tech/pet niche.
* Understanding of the US trends/market/customer mentality.

 **Soft skills**

* Analytical skills and creativity.
* Flexible and self-learning mindset.
* Three E’s: **Excellent** communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work **effectively** and **empathetically** in a team environment.
* Strong drive for execution and achievement.
* Critical attention to detail.

 **Benefits**:

* We offer a competitive compensation package tailored to your experience, along with comprehensive company-wide benefits.
* We provide support and plans for personal development.
* Our startup environment is both challenging and fulfilling, fostering rapid personal growth.
* It combines the engineering culture of Silicon Valley with the strong work ethics of our founding team.

  

Our business focuses on the Internet of Things (IoT) and Software-as-a-Service (SaaS), serving a wide range of users. We cover everything imaginable, including hardware, firmware, backend systems, applications, video streaming, payments, chatbots, and machine learning.


If you are a strategic thinker, possess strong business acumen, and have a passion for driving growth through email marketing, we would love to hear from you.



Join us as the Email Marketing Specialist and be an inseparable driver of our marketing success. We value individuals who are passionate about their work and take pride in it.

title: Customer Support Specialist
description:
We’re building a future where every home is professionally managed. One where professional property managers deliver new “Triple Win Experiences” for residents, investors, and their teams. But creating winning experiences that benefit everyone simultaneously? That’s hard.  

  

Now, 1,500+ property management companies are doing it with a fully managed Resident Benefits Package by Second Nature. We bring the expertise, technology, and service that professional property managers need to make experiences convenient, rewarding, and consistent. Our reputation for turning old problems into new revenue streams has made us the only 6-peat national industry vendor of the year.  

  

Join 150+ passionate, thoughtful people who strive to make a difference each day until every home is full of triple win experiences.

 **About the Role**


Second Nature is looking for an experienced Customer Support Specialist to join our growing team to support our customers - property managers and their residents. The Customer Support Specialist helps the team by delivering an unforgettable customer experience, solving customer issues with positive energy, a can-do attitude and a smile you can feel.

 **Job Responsibilities:**

* Answer inbound customer service emails/calls and resolve issues in a timely manner
* Use SalesForce Service Cloud to respond to customer tickets chronologically
* Ensure timely resolution of issues resulting in maximum customer satisfaction
* Deliver a first time resolution with quality and professionalism
* Improve customer experience and create triple wins through proactive customer service, including effective questioning, listening, probing, building rapport and objection handling
* Maintain an accurate directory of customer contact details and company information for assigned clients and their residents as well as proactively seek out opportunities to obtain other information to ensure clean accurate data (in SalesForce and partner platforms)
* Support sales team by ensuring the highest standard of customer service is maintained
* Maintain the highest professional standards and promote our ethics of trust, open communication, creative thinking and cohesive team effort
* Continually strive for excellence while following SOP
* Maintain an excellent understanding of all products within a Resident Benefit Package
* Meet and exceed customer expectations, goals and metrics (this will be measured via GetFeedback or CSat scores)
* Act as first support for technical issues or providing information on any of the products within the RBP
* Review and update information within the product offerings as it relates to client/resident accounts
* Respond to all cases assigned thoroughly and provide a prompt resolution
* Identify opportunities to upsell a client with additional products to current RBP

 **Preferred Qualifications**

* 2+ years experience with customer service, building rapport over the phone and overcoming objections
* Experience with Salesforce Service Cloud (or similar) and G-suite
* Proven experience delivering results while meeting tight deadlines
* Ability to communicate effectively with internal and external stakeholders
* Confident personality with the ability to adapt quickly in a technology-led environment
* Ability to plan and organize workload in a fast-paced environment
* Ability to work successfully as an IC and as part of a team
* Team and customer-service focus
* Ability to work some weekend hours/later weekday hours

 *We get it. Requirements can sometimes hold people back from applying to a job, but don’t let that be the case here. If you believe you have the skills it takes to elevate this role, team, and company, we encourage you to apply for this role.*

 **Remote Work Statement**  

  

This position is a remote-first, work from home position. Second Nature is committed to creating a culture and workplace where remote work fosters collaboration and connections and is a key part of our company story and success. To be successful in a remote work role at Second Nature you must:

* Be available during your scheduled working hours and give your full attention to the completion of your Second Nature job duties
* Have a quiet, professional, distraction-free environment in which to complete your work
* Have access to your own reliable high-speed internet connection
* Attend our bi-annual in-person company meetings (Second Nature will reimburse the cost of your business travel per company guidelines)

 **Why Second Nature?**

* Health First: Medical, Dental, Vision, & Life Insurance; 401K Plan
* Location: Work Remotely from anywhere in the US
* Flexibility: Open PTO and sick days
* The Product: Beyond the awards and 5-star reviews… our clients and customers love what they can do with a fully managed RBP
* Diverse, Inclusive Culture: We embrace employees from all backgrounds with openness and respect
* Training: A supportive team to help you grow your career and unlock your full potential
* Growth: The opportunity to get in on the ground floor of a fast-growing startup that’s designing and developing an exciting category

  

Second Nature is an Equal Opportunity Employer and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any kind. We take action to ensure equal employment opportunities for all candidates and employees and to provide employees with a workplace free of discrimination and harassment. Our hiring decisions are based on business needs, job requirements and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion or belief, family or parental status, or any other status protected by federal and/or state law.

title: Digital Marketing Specialist
company: Quaint Oak Bank & Our Family of Companies
description:
**Quaint Oak Bank is hiring an experienced Digital Marketing Specialist.**  

Join a growing organization that offers excellent opportunities for career growth, a team atmosphere, and a competitive benefits package!
**Location:** Remote  

**Position Summary:** This role will focus on building the Quaint Oak brand through social media marketing, offsite SEO, and other relevant digital marketing initiatives.  

**Essential Duties & Responsibilities:**
* Manage social media channels for Quaint Oak Bank and its subsidiaries including content scheduling in HubSpot
* Ability to generate and implement effective social media advertising campaigns
* Social media profile optimization for all company profiles
* Produce graphics for social media posts that support each channel
* Monitor social media channels and the web for comments, @mentions, and messages
* Create templates for internal teams to use on social media
* Increase brand awareness, organic social media following and engagement
* Collaborate with the Marketing team to develop social media campaign strategy
* Stay up to date on social media industry best practices, monitoring trends and recommending improvements
* Perform offsite search engine optimization (SEO) tactics through citation building, backlinking, and outreach
* Claim, manage, and optimize online business listings (e.g. Google Business, Bing for Business, etc.), monitoring and responding to reviews
* Present an activity report for social media community engagement, including @mentions, comments, and other relevant brand awareness metrics

**Education & Experience:**

title: Experto en Marketing Digital
description:
