title: Digital Marketing Coordinator
description:
**Who We’re Looking For**

**Our mission is to make email better by spreading DMARC everywhere, but at our core, we’re people helping people.**

**Our Marketing Team is focused on demystifying email and letting people know how it can be made safer by using open-standard protocols that we advocate and support. We’ve developed a robust inbound channel over the past decade, and you can help us expand our outbound channel. We work in a progressive, remote-first, asynchronous environment and have adopted a horizontal hierarchy where we work without the traditional top-down pressure of management layers.** 

**As our Digital Marketing Associate, your focus will be on helping us spread the word about DMARC by providing insights while curating our SEO and PPC campaigns, shepherding our social media presence and being the coordinator of our email campaigns and other digital outreach efforts**

**Who We’re Looking For**  
\\*  
**Organized. You’re detail-oriented and capable of managing and prioritizing concurrent projects in an asynchronous environment.**

\\*  
**Communicator. Working remotely will be an opportunity for your communication skills to shine not only in our social media posts, but as you interact with your colleagues via email, instant messaging and virtual meetings.** 

\\*  
**Storyteller. You can interpret the analytics of pageviews and open rates of our various websites (dmarcian.com, dmarc.io, dmarc-academy.com) to help us tell a story so we can better understand how our efforts are impacting company goals.**

\\*  
**Curious. Curiosity drives you and you have a belief in change. You’re driven to learn about DMARC and its supportive technologies.**

\\*  
**Empathetic. You’ve researched us and you resonate with our culture and values. With the capacity to acknowledge and resolve problems, you practice empathy and patience with coworkers.**

\\*  
**Experienced. A strong preference will be given to those with experience in cybersecurity or SaaS. We’re looking for folks who have worked with the following:**

\\*  
**Wordpress**

\\*  
**Google Analytics (GA4) and PPC campaigns, including producing monthly reports and dashboards for select KPIs.**

\\*  
**Twitter, Facebook and LinkedIn in a management/administrative capacity**

\\*  
**SendGrid (or similar email platform) with experience in coordinating campaigns**

\\*  
**Copywriting and copyediting**

**Responsibilities**  
\\*  
**Manage our social media presence by drafting and scheduling posts with a consistent tempo.**

\\*  
**Monitor our digital marketing efforts, including monitoring and reporting on Google Ads and Google Analytics (GA4).**

\\*  
**Ensure that our content (web pages and blog posts) is optimized to preserve and nurture our strong SEO ranking.**

\\*  
**Assist with building content in WordPress.**

\\*  
**Collaborate with other departments to continuously improve processes as we introduce enhancements and new products and services.**

\\*  
**Assist the Marketing Team with copywriting, proofreading, and other projects as needed.**

**Role Objectives**  
\\*  
**Continue to nourish and grow our social media presence.**

\\*  
**Coordinate and report on GA4, PPC and email campaign analytics.**

\\*  
**Assist Marketing’s efforts in creating awareness and understanding of DMARC and its supportive technologies to a wide range of audiences.**

Job Type: Full-time

Salary: $60,000.00 - $65,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Dental insurance
* Flexible schedule
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Parental leave
* Professional development assistance
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift

Experience:

* Social Media/Content Creation: 3 years (Required)

Work Location: Remote

title: Digital Marketing & Sales Specialist (Fully Remote, Part Time)
description:
**Digital Marketing & Sales Specialist (Fully Remote, Part Time)**

Great Team Building is an online team building and games company looking to hire a part-time Digital Marketing & Sales Specialist, with the opportunity for advancement, who will implement marketing initiatives and play a role in planning the marketing for our current virtual games, future team building events, and the brand as a whole. We are a start up that has grown rapidly, serving hundreds of clients including Fortune 500 companies, and continuing to grow.

This position is 100%, fully remote with a flexible schedule of 20 hours a week.

The Digital Marketing Specialist will work primarily independently and occasionally with a small team to market our online, live-streamed events for corporate clients as we re-envision our web and digital presence. Events include murder mysteries, escape room experiences, and creative workshops.

The Digital Marketing Specialist will have the opportunity both to participate in strategic discussions, pitching ideas, as well as implement those strategies. You will be responsible for managing and optimizing search engine campaigns, as well as identifying and contacting sales prospects. You may also assist with marketing materials copy, landing page development and edits, and other marketing and sales initiatives.

* You are excited about a variety of aspects of modern marketing and sales, diving into both organic and paid marketing initiatives that will grow the brand.
* You like using data to follow what works and enjoy tweaking to get the best results.
* You’re looking to actively implement ideas after participating in high level discussions, seeing first-hand the impact of your work.
* You’re excited to continue growing within the entertainment industry and/or B2B space.
* You enjoy improving processes and ad strategy to make things better and better.
* You love to exceed set goals and take on new projects.
* You are excited about both digital marketing and sales prospecting.
* You're known to operate with passion, urgency, focus, and discipline
* You have high standards, take ownership of your work and are invested in the outcome
* You're comfortable working independently as well as influencing cross-functional teams.
* Fully remote, work from home
* Flexible schedule
* PTO after probationary period
* Professional development opportunities: budget allocated for coaching, mentorship, and professional development programming.
* Tickets to virtual escape rooms and other social events with our team. We believe that teams that play together work better together!
* Experiencing our events with friends and family for free. We want you to experience us firsthand!
* Batchelor’s Degree in marketing, business administration, communications, or a related field
* 2-3 years experience in digital marketing and paid ads
* Experience in marketing digital professional services, B2B marketing, and/or events
* Understanding of Google ads, analytics, and google tag manager
* Track record of improving ROI on campaigns
* Be prompt to meetings and maintain a quality internet connection in an environment without other background noise
* Ability to work effectively while remote, both independently and in small teams
* Experience and comfort working in a deadline-driven environment.
* Ability to handle concurrent assignments and meet deadlines
* Proficiency with Microsoft Office and Google Workspace
* Excellent oral and written communication skills
* Experience with graphic design tools (such as Canva) a plus
* $24-$40/hour with opportunity for annual bonus based on KPIs
* PTO available after probationary period
* Run and manage Google/search engine ads, optimizing for performance
* Set up and monitor Google tags manager tracking
* Make WordPress website & landing page edits
* Identify and contact sales prospects
* Write marketing copy for website and emails
* Participate in strategic discussions and implement new initiatives
* Prepare formal monthly reviews of analytics and insights for all ad platforms with actionable suggestions for growth
* Other duties as assigned

Attention to detail and a friendly attitude are great!

To apply, please email a resume and cover letter to hello@greatteambuilding.com with the subject “Marketing & Sales Application”.

Job Type: Part-time

Pay: $24.00 - $40.00 per hour

Expected hours: 20 per week

Benefits:

* Flexible schedule
* Paid time off
* Professional development assistance
* Work from home

Compensation package:

* Bonus opportunities

Travel requirement:

* No travel

Work Location: Remote

title: Client Success Director - Digital Marketing
description:
**Summary:**



Terakeet is the preferred owned asset optimization (OAO) partner for Fortune 500 brands seeking online business growth. Our mission and purpose are to bring brands and their audiences together to create meaningful connections. As an organization that knows our people are our greatest asset, we believe in creating a culture based on engagement, growth and fulfillment. That's why our values of Teamwork, Grit, Excellence, Impact, and Partnership guide our hiring and employment philosophy.


**Why Terakeet?**



At Terakeet, we're comfortable with the uncomfortable. We live in the future of marketing and are revolutionizing how the world's most valuable brands connect with their audiences. We are experts who deliver exceptional outcomes. Together, we win. This is a remote position.


### **Essential Functions**



The Client Success Director is the main point of contact for our top global clients and is the key strategic thought leader. The Client Success Director aligns Terakeet's internal strategy with clients' business goals and objectives, and directs internal client teams to execute innovative organic search marketing programs.



They will be responsible for managing multi-million dollar client accounts and will have access to the C- Suite of Fortune 1000 organizations.



The CSD reports directly to a Managing Director of Client Success.



Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the following essential functions:


* Builds solid partnerships with account and project teams, and identifies and executes solutions in line with Terakeet's strategic road map and contractual obligations with clients
* Owns client business objectives, maps strategy to economic impact outcomes for their client portfolio, and maintains relationships with Enterprise Partners
* Manages relationships with internal and external executives, crafting succinct and impactful summaries of progress
* Accountable to leadership for revenue retention and driving client outcomes
* Works alongside Enterprise Partners to support the growth of client portfolio
* Serves as primary POC for applicable clients
* Works alongside SEO Directors to ensure strategic roadmaps are aligned with client business objectives and with cross-functional delivery teams to ensure business deliverables are met
* Owns retention strategy and planning, and collaborates with Enterprise Partners on growth execution planning
* Leader in working with internal teams to identify and vet new opportunities for account expansion and builds out compelling and measurable campaigns for our clients
* Reporting on client KPIs and business deadlines
* Leader in understanding the client's competitive landscape and keeps abreast of marketing and advertising trends
* Lead client quarterly business reviews and future planning meetings to ensure KPIs are on track and achieving outcomes
* Supports portfolio growth planning and execution for enterprise-level clients by demonstrating program success


*Contributes to the team culture of growth and innovation*


*The above description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee. Other duties, responsibilities, and activities may change or be assigned at any time with or without notice.*


### **Preferred Education, Experience, and Skills**


* Ten or more years of professional work experience in a related role
* Track record of successfully retaining client relationships and budgets with a partnership-first focus at a senior level
* Solid understanding of search engine optimization and the ways in which branded and non-branded organic authority and visibility are earned via the web
* Experience developing client specific strategies and KPIs that are in line with business goals, objectives, and budgets
* Hands-on experience managing multiple enterprise client accounts and handling day-to-day client interaction
* Comfortable presenting in group settings and directly to any/all levels of an organization
* Strong verbal, written, and digital communication skills
* Bachelor's Degree in Marketing, Advertising, Communications, PR or Business
* Experience managing relationships with C-level executives and/or Fortune 1000 clients


**Pay Transparency**



The salary range for this role is $94,000 to $142,000. **\\*This salary range is based off of the market pay for all of the United States; Terakeet applies a multiplier to this range based upon the specific geographic location of a job candidate\\***


### **EEO Statement**


### **Terakeet provides equal employment opportunity to all individuals regardless of their race, color, creed, religion, gender, age, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by state, federal, or local law.**

title: Digital Marketing Specialist
description:
Position Summary:

Amerit Fleet Solutions is looking for an experienced Digital Marketing Specialist to join our team. As the Digital Marketing Specialist, you will play a key role in supporting all Search Engine Marketing (SEM). This includes but is not limited to supporting advertising campaigns on Google, LinkedIn, Programmatic, etc. This also includes supporting organic keyword campaigns and search engine optimization (SEO) efforts.  

Compensation: Competitive Pay - Paid weekly, every Friday! Salary Range: $75,000 - $85,000 **What’s in it for you?** *Benefits include medical, dental, vision, paid holidays, unlimited PTO, 401K, flexible spending accounts, life insurance, disability insurance, growth opportunities, progressive company culture, and so much more!*
Essential Duties & Responsibilities:
* Manage PPC campaigns with keyword adjustments, expansions, bidding strategy optimization and more.
* Create, monitor, and optimize digital ads across various channels.
* Perform A/B tests across multiple channels on different advertisements. Recommend best practices and strategy decisions.
* Report on campaign performances across all managed platforms including but not limited to increase and decrease in activity, geographic impact, conversions, testing, audience insights and more.
* Support SEO efforts with website optimizations, content creation, backlink building and more.
* Support SEO efforts with keyword research, reporting and monitoring.
* Conduct competitive research and run performance analysis comparisons.


Key Competencies and Minimum Education:
* Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Advertising, Communications, or a related field.
* SEO experience required – experience moving keywords up in SERP.
* Proficient in scheduling ad-flights and keeping campaigns aligned with budgets and monetary limits.
* Proven experience and successful outcomes running Google Advertising campaigns. Google Certifications preferred, not required. (1-3 years of experience managing campaigns)
* 1-2 years experience with SEMRush preferred, not required
* Experience with WordPress preferred, not required

title: Digital Lending Specialist
description:
**ABOUT THE COMPANY:**



Nymbus (https://nymbus.com/) isn't just a leader in fintech; we're a community of innovators passionate about reimagining banking. Our award-winning modern core platform and cloud-based technology serve as the backbone for financial institutions eager to modernize and excel.



Here, you won't just be part of a tech revolution; you'll be at the helm, driving change. You'll fit right in if you're a creative thinker eager to lessen technical debt and elevate agility for banks and credit unions. Our culture thrives on collaboration, integrity, and a client-first approach.



Your journey with us won't simply advance your career; it will offer the chance to shape an industry alongside like-minded professionals. We're excited to consider you a key player in this transformative chapter. Thank you for contemplating a role with Nymbus.

**WORK ENVIRONMENT:**



We are a remote first company with the exception of a few positions being onsite in our designated locations. The positions which are remote you will need to be able to travel a few times a year. You may be required at times to visit client sites or attend meetings at designated locations with your team members.


**POSITION SUMMARY:**



Under the supervision of the Digital Operations Manager, the Digital Lending Specialist will perform a variety of loan processing and operational functions in connection with Commercial and Consumer loans. This includes managing and coordinating the loan processing functions and any operational activities related to the commercial and consumer loan lifecycle.

  


**ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS/RESPONSIBILITIES****:**

  


**Loan Approval and Documentation:**


* Ensure accurate and proper approval, documentation, closing, funding, and booking of loans.
* Adhere to applicable credit approvals, loan policies, state and federal regulations, and legal standards.


**Loan Processing and Support:**


* Provide quality service and effective loan processing support for digital lending clients.
* Assist in gathering, preparing, and maintaining loan documentation for new and existing loans.


**Knowledge Management:**


* Establish and maintain organized files and records for loan documentation.
* Build and maintain lending procedures, checklists, and workflows to ensure compliance and meet service level agreements (SLAs).


**Quality Assurance:**


* Maintain high levels of service, quality, and compliance in all business lending workflow processes.
* Complete loan checklists, personal loan audits, and participate in quality assurance (QA) and audit requests.


**Reporting and Compliance:**


* Ensure appropriate documentation is received and completed at the time of application and/or origination.


**Post-Closing Duties:**


* Perform various post-closing duties, including following up on final title policies and deeds, paying fees, and conducting quality control.


**Process Improvement:**


* Participate in the review and recommendation of automation and/or robotic systems to enhance scalability and eliminate manual processes.


**Issue Resolution and Support:**


* Support audit requests, regulatory updates, compliance requests, and resolve loan operational issues in a timely manner.


**Client Relationship:**


* Demonstrate a thorough understanding of client lending policies, procedures, and philosophies.
* Apply loan expertise to create or refine a best-in-class program for digital clients, ensuring world-class experiences for end-users.


**Problem Solving:**


* Identify and investigate problems independently, asking pertinent questions to drive shared understanding.


**Additional Responsibilities:**


* Perform other duties as assigned by DXC Leadership.
  


**PREFERRED EXPERIENCE****:**

  


* Experience analyzing financial data related to loan requests
* Experience Performing risk assessments on potential loan recipients based on credit rating, borrowing history, and other specific risk factors
* Applied knowledge of underwriting fundamentals and standard industry practices

  


**QUALIFICATIONS****:**

  

* 1-2 years experience in a lending support role (i.e., unsecured, commercial, mortgage, SBA, special assets, etc.)
* Experience in multiple products and/or multiple phases of the commercial and/or consumer loan lifecycle is preferred
* Current on trends in Fintech and Lending; familiarity with the digital banking ecosystem is a plus
* Highly passionate and positive in a rapidly changing and fast-paced environment
* Ability to work under pressure and in an organized manner delivering consistent results
* Experience with solving problems through technology and ability to make decisions
* Excellent communication skills and outstanding active listening abilities
* Experience using tools and loan origination platforms, and credit analysis software
* Ability to manage multiple tasks/projects and deadlines simultaneously


Salary & Benefits:


* $50,000 - $60,000 Annual Salary
* Annual Cash Bonus and Equity Options commensurate with the role level and experience
* 100% Fully Remote
* Robust 401(k) plan with company match
* Insurance - Health, Dental and Vision (Nymbus covers 100% of the Healthcare and Basic Dental premiums)
* Flexible Paid Time Off

  

Ready to join? We invite you to watch this video and learn who we are and how we build and innovates together!



Let's Go!

title: Customer Support - Phones, Emails (3685)
description:
**ModSquad** has partnered with multiple top tier brands/clients across the globe and we need the best of the best in **Customer Support!**

Do you have a **Support** background?
Do you enjoy work-from-home and flexible schedules?
ModSquad is seeking Mod Contractors to join our network!

If you want the chance to work gigs on the coolest of client projects... **then ModSquad is the place for you!!** Our clients are strictly Top Tier whose product offerings and services are hip, contemporary and very current. You will instantly know who they are and very likely use them yourselves. Their customers expect the best service and support and that's where we come in.

Our Mods bring super skills, a positive attitude and great vibe to project work everyday. Mods assist and guide customers to the right answers, solve concerns and are the GPS for customers to understand and optimize the best use of a client's product or services. Project gigs available now and more are on the horizon.  

  

**ModSquad** has partnered with our clientwhose software identifies property owners that are overpaying on their property taxes and uses automation to earn them reductions on their tax bills.  

This is **NOT** a sales role, but rather a warm answering service to customers inquiring about the client's services.  

Mods will help in answering questions about the service, and the sign-up process, and providing updates on current account status via phone and email support. **This is a temporary, seasonal contract, ending in June.**  

**Project Hours (All Times Pacific):**
Monday - Friday, 7 am - 5 pm **Hourly Pay Rate:**
To be discussed in the interview phase **Commitment:**
20 hours per week
90 days (as needed) **Orientation Begins:**
March 18, 2024
### **What We Are Looking For:**

* Pleasant phone voice
* Phone experience in a call center environment is preferred but not required
* Strong multitasking skills, with a passion for research and learning new things each day
* Energetic and positive individuals that take pride in helping people find the best solution
* Familiarity with property tax or taxes in general is a bonus

### **WorkSpace Requirements:**

* Dedicated laptop or desktop computer with Windows 10 or above
* Quality headset
* Quiet workspace to take calls
* Willingness to install MSQ security software and 2FA app on the phone

### **What’s In It For You:**

* The potential to work with some of the coolest clients around the world like the NFL, Vimeo, and Topps!
* Flexible self-scheduling
* Access to ‘Hot Gigs’ postings exclusive to the Mod Network
* Work from home
* Competitive hourly rate - Discussed during your first interview
* Paid orientation

**\\*\\*\\*IMPORTANT\\*\\*\\*: Take your time and make sure you do a thorough job in completing your application. Your responses should be grammatically correct and comprehensive. This will greatly increase the probability of scoring an interview!** **Please note: A Chromebook is not sufficient for ModSquad projects.** **Who is ModSquad?**
ModSquad is a global provider of managed digital engagement services. Our 10,000+ Mods chat with customers, moderate web content, manage communities, and buzz in social media for many of the world’s coolest brands, including the NFL, Zendesk, and Topps, to name a few. We bring companies closer to their customers than ever before. From global enterprises to international agencies to hip new startups, our clients have reaped the benefits of putting ModSquad's expertise to work. With experienced Mods available in 50+ languages in 70+ countries, we’re your squad for the digital world. *ModSquad is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy), gender, national origin, ancestry, age, physical or mental disability, military status, status as a veteran or disabled veteran, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital or family status, genetic information, medical condition, or any other basis protected by applicable federal, state, or local law, ordinance, or regulation.* *Individual base pay depends on various factors, in addition to primary work location, such as complexity and responsibility of role, job duties/requirements, and relevant experience and skills.* *\\*\\*\\*Pay rates vary by client and are not negotiable. Rates will be disclosed during the interview process*

title: Digital Marketing Specialist
description:
**Job Title:** Digital Marketing Specialist  

**Department:** Marketing  

**Reports to:** Managing Director  

**Location:** Pittsburgh, PA, USA or Remote  

  

**About Pair Networks:**  

Pair Networks is a renowned leader in the web hosting and domain services industry, boasting over two decades of expertise and innovation. Since our inception in 1996, we have been committed to delivering unparalleled hosting and domain solutions to individuals, businesses, and organizations worldwide. Our mission is to empower our clients to thrive online by providing reliable, scalable, and cutting-edge hosting and domain services.
**Job Summary:**  

Supports the digital marketing strategy by implementing programs and tactics to increase product demand, enhance sales, identify additional sales channels, attract traffic to the company website, and promote an online presence. Utilizes search engine optimization (SEO) analytics and search engine marketing (SEM) techniques to increase traffic to the website. Develops, curates, and deploys compelling content to attract, engage and retain visitors and promote sales. Prepares and launches social media, email, and mobile marketing campaigns. Collects and analyzes online statistics to identify marketplace trends and best practices to optimize online marketing performance.  

  

**Job Responsibilities:**
* Develop and execute digital marketing strategies to increase brand awareness, drive website traffic, and generate leads for web hosting services.
* Manage all aspects of online advertising campaigns, including Google Ads, social media ads, and display advertising, to optimize performance and achieve ROI goals.
* Create engaging content for various digital channels, including website, blog, social media, email newsletters, and online forums, to attract and engage target audiences.
* Monitor and analyze key performance metrics across digital channels using tools such as Google Analytics, SEMrush, and HubSpot to identify trends, insights, and areas for improvement.
* Implement SEO best practices to improve search engine rankings and organic visibility for relevant keywords related to web hosting services.
* Collaborate with the content team to develop SEO-friendly content, including blog posts, articles, videos, and infographics, to support digital marketing initiatives.
* Manage social media accounts, including Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn, and Instagram, to foster community engagement, respond to inquiries, and promote web hosting products and features.
* Conduct market research and competitive analysis to identify opportunities, trends, and emerging technologies in the web hosting industry, and provide recommendations for staying ahead of the competition.
* Coordinate with internal teams, including sales, product development, and customer support, to align digital marketing efforts with business objectives and ensure consistent messaging across all touchpoints.
* Stay informed about digital marketing trends, industry developments, and best practices, and actively seek out opportunities for professional growth and skill development in the field.


  

**Required Skills and Abilities:**
* Strong understanding of SEO, social media marketing, email marketing, and website analytics.
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
* Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
* Data-driven approach with a focus on results and optimization.
* Passion for the web hosting industry and technology.


  

**Required Education and Experience:**
* Bachelor's degree in marketing, communications, or a related field
* 1+ years of experience in digital marketing (preferred)


  

**Benefits:**
* Medical Coverage
* Employer Paid Dental and Vision Coverage
* Employer Paid Short-Term and Long-Term Disability Coverage
* Employer Paid and Voluntary Life Insurance
* 401(k) Saving Plan
* Paid Vacations and 14 Paid Holidays
* Opportunities for Flexible Work Arrangements
* Educational Opportunities


  

**Equal Employment Opportunity Policy:**  

The Company is an equal opportunity employer. Applicants for employment are, and will be, recruited, selected and hired, and employment decisions are and will be made, without discrimination on the bases of race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin or disability. This policy applies to new employees, promotions and all personnel actions within the organization.  

  

The Company prides itself on the contribution it makes to the community. It is the intent of the Company to comply with all federal, state and local laws relating to equal employment opportunity.

title: Digital Communication Specialist, remote
description:
Create compelling content, cultivate an online community, and use digital marketing to increase brand awareness that drives conversions in the education sector.
### **Description**


**Social Media Lead: Content & Community Engagement**
McKinney-Vento Learning partners with school districts to ensure that students in unstable situations have access to the necessary resources for learning and personal development. Our technology and training helps schools understand how to identify and assist students experiencing homelessness or instability, ensuring equitable learning opportunities for all. **Overview:**
The Digital Communication Specialist will elevate our online presence and create community. As a strategic thinker, you will be the voice of our digital marketing efforts, driving brand awareness and ensuring the successful adoption of our technology by school districts. **Responsibilities:*** **Engage:** Build an online community that supports our goals.
* **Create**: Develop copy that expands the visibility of our software to school districts and fosters a strong sense of community.
* **Analyze:** Use data to optimize strategies and increase brand awareness.
* **Convert:** Run campaigns that turn interest into action.

 **Requirements:*** Exceptional writing skills, with a strong foundation in SEO, PPC, content management, and possibly graphic design.
* Senior-level experience developing and executing email marketing campaigns that effectively inform and convert.
* A portfolio showcasing successful social media management, content creation, and community engagement initiatives.
* Proven digital marketing expertise, with a strong foundation in Copywriting, SEO, PPC, content management, and possibly graphic design.
* Bachelors in Marketing, Communications, or a related field, or equivalent experience.
* Your commitment to making a difference aligns with our mission, driving you to achieve impactful results.
* Your approach is data-driven, guiding your strategies and decisions to maximize impact.

 **Apply Now:**
Please submit your resume, portfolio, and availability for an interview this week. This is a fully remote role and requires availability Monday through Friday from 8 am to 5 pm EST.

title: Digital Marketing Specialist I
description:
**About NMG:**


Nationwide Marketing Group works on behalf of thousands of Independent appliance, furniture, bedding, electronics, specialty electronics, custom installation and rent-to-own dealers, helping them grow their businesses and thrive on their own terms. With more than 5,000 Members operating some 14,000 storefronts, Nationwide Marketing Group is the largest buying, marketing and business support organization of its kind, representing billions in combined annual sales across the membership. For 50 years, the organization has remained committed to the Independent channel, empowering Members with the scale, sophistication and efficiencies they need to compete while delivering the unmatched business intelligence, tools and resources required to win in an ever-changing business environment. To learn more, visit our website at nationwidegroup.org or Nationwide Marketing Group LinkedIn

**Job Location: Open to US Remote Candidates**

**Job Summary:**


The Digital Marketing Specialist I will be responsible for managing and supporting paid digital strategies for NMG’s retail customers. The position requires managing specific key accounts and implementing leading digital technologies.

**Job Responsibilities:**

* Independently develop media plans aligned with strategic client goals
* Proactively make campaign optimization and strategy recommendations to improve ROAS based on analysis of performance metrics and results
* Analyze and communicate insights to clients based on campaign reports
* Follow up with supporting specialists on monthly calls.
* Develop budgets and SOWs for client projects in conjunction with the other members of the team
* Check all client services and media billing for accuracy and review against estimate(s)
* Participate in client proposals, and new business pitches
* Develop campaign budgets and recommended project scopes in collaboration with project manager, design team and website team.
* Oversee the implementation, optimization, and support for client campaigns
* Lead the presentation of campaign results and actions taken to successfully manage campaigns
* Provide expanded support for social, display, retargeting, and list-based strategies as needed (with support of existing team of strategists/specialists)
* Prioritize tasks and manage time appropriately to meet inflexible deadlines

**Job Qualifications:**

* Bachelor’s in Marketing or related digital marketing course
* Average Account Budget up to $25k
* Some Google Ads and Facebook Ads experience, but little to no practical, hands-on experience.
* Ability to create strategic briefs and media plans under supervision of a manager
* Ability to travel an average of 4 times per year
* Excellent communication skills, both written and oral
* Must be comfortable working with remote clients
* Exceptional ability to multi-task, prioritize and be adaptable to change
* Understanding of reporting and tracking methods for digital marketing media
* Proficient in Microsoft Excel, PowerPoint and Google Docs (Docs, Sheets, Slides)

**Job** **Competencies:**

* Must be detail-oriented
* Work well in a team environment
* Must be able to think critically and logically.
* Must be proactive and have a continuous learning mindset.
* Passion for all things digital and eagerness to learn
* Genuine interest in internet trends and staying on top of digital platform updates

**Work Environment:**


Must be able to read, write, and communicate both verbally and in written form to express and exchange ideas. While performing the responsibilities of this job, the employee must be able to access all components of the workstation and other office equipment. Frequent typing, writing, bending, and twisting. Must be able to lift up to 10 pounds.


General office environment with moderate noise. This position is mostly sedentary, involves sitting most of the time, but may involve walking or standing for brief periods of time. A busy environment with many unscheduled interruptions. Frequent computer use at workstation for extended periods of time. Public contact position requiring appropriate business apparel.  

  

**Why you want to work with NMG:**


Nationwide Marketing Group is an equal opportunity employer that does not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, sex, age, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, status as a veteran, and basis of disability or any other federal, state, or local protected class. We believe that the future of our organization depends on building a diverse, representative, and inclusive team. We strongly encourage individuals of all backgrounds to apply. Should you need any reasonable accommodations through the interview process, please let us know.  

  

**NMG offers:**

* Competitive base pay and performance bonus, dependent on role.
* Medical, Dental, Vision with $0 cost Employee Only coverage options
* Employer Paid Basic Life/AD&D
* Employer Paid Short-Term and Long-Term Disability
* MetLife supplemental insurance benefit options
* Matching 401K with 100% vesting
* Open PTO Policy, Paid Holidays, Paid Maternity/Paternity to help you balance work and personal life
* Business casual work environment
* Discounts Program on Electronics, Cells Phones, Health & Wellness, Travel, Entertainment, Home & Auto, Pet Insurance and more!

title: Digital Marketing Associate
description:
Designity is seeking a customer-centric and self-starter for the role of Digital Marketing Associate at Designity. This role is hybrid which means you will be working on internal Designity projects and assisting with Designity client projects from time to time. Your position involves leveraging expertise in Social Media Management, Google Ads, crafting content calendars and in general collaborating directly with our marketing team to brainstorm and launch new campaigns based on recent trends. Your roles would be mostly following directions and executing on projects and monitoring metrics.

Designity is a subscription-based collaborative creative platform that enables creatives and businesses to collaborate more effectively through unique and innovative model. This collaborative approach has convinced both small and large companies, including Calendly, Kung Fu Tea, and Marriott Hotels, to use Designity for their design and marketing efforts instead of traditional, costly, and inefficient alternatives.

We are transforming the creative industry, moving away from outdated and ineffective marketing and design methods. Companies typically hire in-house designers, which is costly, time-consuming, skill-limiting, and requires substantial supervision. Working with traditional design and marketing agencies offers an alternative but at a high cost. Marketplaces like Upwork and Fiverr claim to offer a more affordable solution, but their model lacks reliability and optimization for creative services, causing frustration for businesses.

While we still operate like a startup, we are in full scale- up mode. If you are looking for a clear career growth plan, fully remote, and the opportunity to join a growing team that is disrupting the creative industry - then Designity is the place for you.

**Responsibilities:**

* **Execute Marketing Initiatives:**
* Execute on marketing projects alongside your team.
* Leverage storytelling and creative problem-solving skills.
* Drive brand awareness through brainstorming, concept development, and audience captivation.
* **Develop Unique Strategies:**
* Generate recommendations for inbound and outbound marketing tactics based on latest trends.
* Set up and manage paid/unpaid social media campaigns, Google Ads, and email campaigns.
* Implement A/B testing strategies.
* **Measure and Report:**
* Monitor and report on marketing campaign performance.
* Gain insights and assess results against client goals as well as Designity projects.
* **Digital Marketing Project Management:**
* Complete high-quality and on-schedule digital marketing projects.
* Serve clients across a variety of industries.

**Qualifications:**

* **Digital Marketing Expertise:**
* Minimum of 2-3 years in digital marketing with a focus on social media content management, and paid media, ideally with B2B companies.
* **Passionate Consumer Driver:**
* Enthusiastic about influencing consumer behavior through digital advertising.
* **Social Media Management Skills:**
* Experience in social media content calendar management.
* **Analytical Proficiency:**
* Exceptional analytical skills with hands-on experience using various tools such as GA4, Hotjar, Optimizely, Google Console Analytics, etc…
* **Campaign Development and Measurement:**
* Thorough understanding of developing and measuring successful digital campaigns and promotions.
* **Organized and Deadline-Oriented:**
* Highly organized with a commitment to deadlines, consistently delivering high-quality projects.
* **Proactive Planning:**
* Ability to create initial plans with minimal input, seeking feedback for necessary updates and revisions.
* **Motivated Team Player:**
* Hands-on, self-driven, highly motivated, and team-oriented with an entrepreneurial mindset.

‍**ADDITIONAL INFO:**

* Fully remote option.
* Clear Career growth plan
* “No Meetings Wednesday”
* 401k and Health Insurance Benefits after 3 months
* Unlimited paid vacation, company holidays, and mental health days

*Compensation: $65,000 - $85,000 (total of commission and base)*

*In order to be considered for this position, you need to complete the application process at www.designity.com/careers/digital-marketing-associate*

*Please do NOT follow up on your application. We will be in touch within 2-3 weeks if you're qualified.*

*At Designity, all employment decisions are based on business needs, qualifications, and merit. Designity is an Equal Opportunity Employer. The more inclusive we are, the better our work will be. We believe that a workforce diverse in cultures, perspectives, skills, and experiences will benefit our team, clients, and products.*

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $65,000.00 - $85,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k) matching
* Flexible schedule
* Health insurance
* Life insurance
* Paid time off

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Monday to Friday

Work Location: Remote

title: Digital Marketing Specialist - Social Media & PPC
description:
**Digital Marketing Specialist - Social Media & PPC Focus**

  



Location: Provo Utah (Local Applicants Only)

  


**About DentalCMO:**



DentalCMO is on the lookout for a talented Digital Marketing Specialist with a dual focus on Social Media ad buying and PPC to join our team. As a growing dental marketing company, we are dedicated to delivering innovative marketing solutions that drive results. If you are creative, analytical, and passionate about leveraging social media platforms and PPC campaigns to enhance online visibility and engagement, you might be the perfect fit for our team.

  


**Key Areas of Responsibility:**


* Social Media Management: Develop and implement social media strategies to increase engagement, brand awareness, and drive traffic across platforms such as Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, and LinkedIn.
* PPC Campaign Management: Plan, execute, and optimize PPC campaigns across Google AdWords, Bing Ads, and social media platforms to achieve targeted results and maximize ROI.
* Client Onboarding: Efficiently onboard new clients to our platforms, ensuring a clear understanding of their goals and how our social media and PPC strategies will meet their needs.
* Continuous Communication: Keep clients informed through regular updates, weekly calls, and emails, ensuring transparency and client satisfaction.
* Content Collaboration: Work closely with the content team to create compelling, targeted content for social media posts and PPC ads.
* Analytics and Reporting: Monitor, analyze, and report on the performance of social media and PPC campaigns, utilizing data to inform and adjust strategies as needed.
* Quality Assurance: Oversee all content and campaigns, ensuring they align with client objectives and DentalCMO’s standards before publication.
* Community and Relationship Building: Manage online communities, engage with audiences, and foster positive relationships through interactive and engaging communication.

  


**Essential Skills:**


* Proficiency in managing social media platforms and PPC campaigns.
* Strong understanding of analytics tools such as Google Analytics, Facebook Insights, and PPC reporting tools.
* Excellent organizational skills, with the ability to manage multiple projects and clients simultaneously.
* Outstanding communication skills for effective client and team interactions.
* Creative thinking with the ability to generate innovative ideas and strategies.

  


**Qualifications:**


* Bachelor's degree in Marketing, Communications, or a related field.
* Demonstrated experience with social media management and PPC campaign execution (a must).
* Expertise in using collaboration tools like GSuite, Asana, HubSpot, and Slack.
* Familiarity with social media scheduling and analytics tools.

  


**Personal Attributes:**


* A detail-oriented and punctual professional with a positive attitude.
* A team player who is energetic, enthusiastic, and client-focused.
* Adaptable and open to continuous learning and development in digital marketing trends and tools.

  


**Compensation and Benefits:**


* Competitive salary.
* Two weeks of paid time off per year, plus all typical holidays.
* 401K / HSA options.
* Paid access to a local physician for the employee and their family.

  


**DentalCMO Core Values:**


* We Are Ridiculously Responsive.
* Our Clients Are Our Friends.
* We Take Pride in Our Craft.
* We Are Givers.
* We Practice Kaizen.
* We Are Wise Stewards.
* We Are Professional and Have Fun.

  


**Application Process:**



Interested candidates should submit a cover letter detailing why they are the ideal fit for the Digital Marketing Specialist position, **emphasizing their experience in social media and PPC related work**. Join our Provo-based team and play a significant role in our clients' success stories.

title: Customer Onboarding Specialist - North and South America Region - 100% Remote
description:
Hostaway is the fastest-growing global SaaS start-up in the vacation rental industry. Our products provide the best and most cost-effective solutions for property managers and vacation rental owners. Our major partners include Airbnb, Booking.com, Expedia, and several other leaders in the industry. Since launching in 2015, Hostaway has been rapidly expanding our teams in Toronto, Barcelona, and many other remote locations.

  

Work with us. Grow with us. Win with us. Our customer-facing Customer Success team is looking for new Onboarding Specialists Specialists who are independent, flexible, and logical. You will be part of the Tier 1 team, responsible for onboarding our clients onto the Hostaway Platform.

  

Who we are: A Scandinavian culture that values freedom, transparency, and success of the individual Super fast-paced team currently growing our international teams and shaping the leaders of tomorrow. A ‘family’ of creatives, big thinkers, and ambitious humans Diverse and open-minded. We don’t care about labels and traditional thinking If you've read this far, we want to hear from you! Please make sure that you put rocket ship in the application. We want to offer you: A chance to be part of an exciting adventure Growth and career opportunities.

  

To ensure a fair and efficient recruitment process, we kindly request that you provide the following job requirements:


* Minimum of 2 years of experience in customer onboarding or a related field
* Strong communication skills, both written and verbal
* Ability to work independently and remotely with minimal supervision
* Proficiency in the English language, both written and spoken
* Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills
* Attention to detail and ability to multitask
* Experience with customer relationship management (CRM) software
* Knowledge of the vacation rental industry is a plus
* Flexibility to work in different time zones, as required
* Stable/fast Internet connection
* A quiet room to work
* We will lend you any necessary hardware (computer, headset, mouse/keyboard)



Please note that these requirements are essential for the successful execution of the Onboarding Specialist role. If you do not meet these requirements, we kindly ask you to consider other opportunities within our organization that may better align with your skills and experience.

  

**Must be able to work in NA/SA Time zone**

  

Manage the entire onboarding process for new customers from sales to configuration, training, and adoption, with a strong sense of urgency and understanding of client needs. Deliver confident training sessions that educate and enable new users, illustrating the benefits of the software, effectively communicating value to customers, and instilling confidence and belief in the product. Enhance current processes in onboarding areas of the business. Nurture clients towards a successful implementation using intimate knowledge of both the industry and the product. Go above and beyond to ensure customers are comfortable using the software by delivering training and catchup sessions, and instruct/guide the customer through tasks, both onsite & online. Bring your own personality to develop rapport and meaningful relationships with customers, building connections and gaining trust. Manage customer expectations aligned with the business processes. Resolve time-sensitive and high-pressure queries Take responsibility, and initiative and coordinate internally to ensure support is always covered.

  

**What will you bring to the team?**

  

Soft skills: You will have an owner mindset, with the ability and inclination to be hands-on in all aspects of the role. Capacity to understand a client’s business wants and needs. Ability to juggle priorities and thrive under pressure. Strong presentation, organization, and time management skills. Excellent oral and written communication. Excellent time management. Meticulous attention to detail. Experienced in working across various teams (sales, marketing, support, etc). Hard skills and experience of 2+ years of project management, SaaS onboarding, account management, or involvement in other customer success positions. 1+ years of experience working at a SaaS company. Experience with HubSpot desirable. Knowledge of Airbnb, Vrbo, the travel industry, or property management is a huge plus.



Who you are/what you know: You have a project management background. You have had success as a part of a fast-growing startup, understanding that processes are constantly maturing. As part of a fast-growing startup, you are willing to wear multiple hats when needed and want to provide feedback to help mature the onboarding process based on your experience. You have experience working in SaaS companies with a client-facing role onboarding clients. You are comfortable writing/speaking English - any other language is a plus. You are independent and proactive - You can search in all available resources available and if you can’t find the answer, you reach out and document the answer for future use. You are comfortable with extensive knowledge of various tools/tech i.e Zendesk, Slack, Jira, Confluence, Google apps, Monday.com, Teamworks, Etc You are remote and flexible - Capable of working full time, mornings or evenings, weekdays or weekends as needed

  

### **What we offer**


* **Competitive Compensation:** We offer competitive pay based on market rates in the country of the applicant.
* **100% Remote:** Enjoy the freedom to work from anywhere within your country of residence—be it a co-working space, your home office, or even your dining room table. The choice is yours. Just don’t ask to work in our office (we don’t have one).
* **Equity:** Every role in our company comes with valuable stock options in a fast-growing and profitable company. This ensures we all share in the company’s success.
* **Values-Driven Leadership:** Our Core Values are not just words we’ve written to make us feel good. We leverage them daily when making strategic and tactical decisions.
* **Professional Growth:** Our rapid growth offers unparalleled learning and development opportunities, along with a multitude of career advancement opportunities.
* **Annual Paid Leave:** The specific amounts vary by country and are aligned with country and/or contract-specific norms.
* **Geographic Specific Benefits:** As an international employer, we offer different country-specific benefits such as Health Insurance and Pensions in countries where these perks are customary. The specifics depend on the country of the applicant.
* **Dynamic Team Culture:** As a global company with team members in over 40 countries, our diverse and international culture fuels our innovation and creativity, providing a key pillar to our success (and making it a lot of fun to work here).

  

Thank you for your interest. If you apply for this role, you will receive an email from our Talent Acquisition team after your application has been reviewed alongside the qualifications for this role and the qualifications of others who have applied.

title: Customer Support Specialist
description:
**About Cherry**

Started in 2019, Cherry is an extremely fast growing FinTech that has built the simplest, fastest, and most inclusive Buy Now, Pay Later solution for medical practices such as dentists, medical aesthetics, veterinarians etc.

Cherry enables medical practices to treat more patients by making their services more financially accessible.Cherry was founded and is led by Stanford entrepreneurs with a previous successful exit and backed by an all-star lineup of investors such as Kleiner Perkins and DCM.

**The Role**

Cherry is seeking experienced Customer Support Specialists who provide a great customer experience and hold a strong regard for delivering results. The position will be carefully chosen to bring in a person who is passionate about being a part of a small but hard-working team in the beginning, with a major focus on building and improving our team and the company as a whole.

**Responsibilities**

* Work with customers to satisfy inquiries with one call resolution in mind.
* Review, monitor, engage and keep track of a high volume of customers per day.
* Handle both inbound and outbound service level calls in order to assist with both applicants, merchants and borrowers.
* Review current strategies and provide feedback on how to improve the department and Cherry as a whole.
* Accurately document all interactions and account level issues with borrowers.
* Provide problem solving resolutions to inquiries and recommend action based on conversation and account assessment.
* Work directly with management for improvements from borrower level all the way to systems and processing level.
* Work in a startup environment with the goal to strive for improvement with both the quality and method of the interaction with borrowers.
* Be an integral part in the growth of a small company with interactions across all departments.
* Evening and/or weekend hours may be required.
* De-escalate scenarios and present resolutions for tough to navigate situations.

**Qualifications**

* 1+ years of experience in customer support/experience.
* Experience with point of sale lending or financial products desired.
* Proven ability to multi-task and de-escalate situations across omni-channel communication inquiries.
* Exceptional ability to prioritize tasks, organize and pay strict attention to detail.
* Strong work ethic and pride in performance.
* Experience working in a start up environment is highly preferred but not required.
* Ability to work independently in a fast paced, ever changing environment with a team first mentality.
* College Degree desired. High school diploma or GED required.
* Intermediate level skills in working with Excel/Google Sheets are also highly preferred.
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Attention to detail is a must.

**Perks**

* This position includes a base pay of $60,000 plus monthly bonus pay for a total OTE of $75,000, as well as equity, medical, vision, and dental benefits.
* A great company culture and a world-class team to work with
* Fully remote company
* Clear path to promotion based on performance

#LI-Remote

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: From $75,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Dental insurance
* Flexible schedule
* Health insurance
* On-the-job training
* Paid time off
* Parental leave
* Referral program
* Vision insurance
* Work from home

Shift:

* 8 hour shift

Weekly day range:

* Monday to Friday
* Rotating weekends

Work setting:

* Remote

Application Question(s):

* Can you please provide any metrics or KPIs you are measured off of in your current role?
* How do you feel your performance stacks up against others on your team? Are you top 10%, 25%, 50%, etc?
* Are you currently employed?

Work Location: Remote

title: Customer Support Specialist
description:
**Open Position:** Customer Support Specialist

**Reports to:** Manager, Customer Support

**Location:** Remote  

  

**Schedule:** 10am-7pm CST

**About Us**


HST Pathways is on a mission to transform healthcare with innovative software technology that enables surgery centers to provide more cost-efficient patient care and better outcomes. Our suite of solutions spans the entire case lifecycle, including scheduling, care coordination, clinical documentation, and revenue cycle. Backed by Bain Capital, we are the fastest growing ASC software company and serve over 1,6 clients, but we’re just getting started and have plans to 10X the value we offer. However, our big ambitions are only as strong as the team behind them, which is why we’re looking to build our team with the best.

**Responsibilities:**


The HST Pathways Support Specialist serves as the customer’s point of contact for all service and support related questions for all HST Pathways application offerings. The support specialist role requires the ability to troubleshoot and resolve application and customer workflow problems with exceptional customer service skills, as well as going above and beyond client expectations. The role requires a self-starter, team player, detail-oriented, able to multi-task, and someone who can communicate effectively to all levels of the organization as well as external parties.


Primary job duties and responsibilities include the follow:

* Problem-solver with exceptional customer service skills, going above and beyond client expectations
* Deliver an exceptional client experience by identifying and documenting client needs and issues
* Answer incoming customer inquiries, effectively applying problem solving techniques, educating clients and following issues through to their successful resolution
* Provide consistent, timely, professional and high-quality client support, every day, all the time, no matter what
* Establish procedures to ensure client satisfaction and quality service delivery
* Communicate and collaborate across teams and departments to help solve issues
* Replicate and document issues for further escalation
* Participate in quality assurance and application testing of software as required

**Qualifications**

* Bachelor’s degree recommended.
* Proficient in MS Office and related products
* You must be technically savvy with an ability to easily learn new software (echart or practice management experience preferred)
* Healthcare or clinical experience preferred
* Exceptional communication skills for both internal and external communications
* Able to manage many ongoing activities and tasks in a fast-paced environment

**Team Culture**

* We go beyond the expected. We strive to be the difference in everything we do and look for ways to innovate and deliver beyond expectations.
* We thrive through collaboration. We invest in our team and take pride in the success of others.
* We strive to make a positive impact. We are passionate our work and leverage our collective creativity and industriousness to make big things happen
* We sharpen and share our expertise. We aspire to learn, grow, and share knowledge.
* We love the journey. We never lose sight of the fact that we’re contributing to building a new model of healthcare delivery.

**Perks & Benefits**

* Remote work environment
* Health benefits paid for employee
* Flexible Paid Time Off Policy
* 11 company holidays per year
* Paid parental leave
* 401K with matching contributions
* Learning and development allowance
* A diverse, inclusive, and fun team!

**HST Pathways celebrates diversity and is steadfast in fostering an inclusive work environment where employees feel valued, respected, and engaged. We champion and nurture a culture where inclusiveness is instinctive and fuels innovation, connection, and a strong sense of “One Team”. HST is deeply committed to representing and reflecting the unique experiences, perspectives and viewpoints of our employees, customers, and the communities we serve.**

title: Digital Paid Marketing Specialist (Remote)
description:
Authority Brands Inc. headquartered in Columbia, MD is a leading provider of home services, building brands that support the success of our franchisees, as well as bettering the lives of the homeowners we serve and the people we employ.
  
  

Authority Brands Inc., headquartered in Columbia, MD is a leading provider of home services, building brands that support the success of our franchisees, as well as bettering the lives of the homeowners we serve and the people we employ. Authority Brands Inc. is seeking a remote Digital Paid Marketing Specialist, an integral part of the team to drive key marketing initiatives and promote the company’s mission and goals.
  
  

**Responsibilities:**  

* Develop and execute data-driven paid marketing campaigns across various platforms, including Google Ads, Facebook, and other relevant channels.
* Hands on management and optimization of the B2B paid campaigns.
* Collaborate with the Franchise Development, Retail, and broader 90+ Marketing teams to define lead generation goals and strategies, ensuring alignment with company objectives.
* Work with external partners, agencies, and vendors to maximize performance and ensure digital marketing efficacy.
* Create and manage engaging ad creatives, landing pages, and conversion paths to maximize lead generation and conversion rates.
* Implement A/B testing and data analysis to refine ad copy, design, and landing page elements for better lead acquisition.
* Continuously monitor, analyze, and optimize campaigns to improve performance and ROI.
* Serve as subject-matter expert for paid campaigns and troubleshoot campaigns as needed.
* Track and report on key performance metrics, providing regular insights and recommendations for campaign improvements.
* Assist other Marketing teams with end-of-month billing and reporting needs.
* Provide ongoing support through regular paid campaign audits and industry research to stay ahead of competitors.
* Stay up-to-date with industry trends, algorithm changes, and emerging platforms to ensure our campaigns remain competitive.
* Stay informed about compliance and privacy regulations to maintain the integrity of lead generation activities.
* Perform other duties as needed.


**Qualifications:**  

* Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Advertising, Business, or a related field
* Minimum 2 years of lead generation and/or paid campaign marketing, agency experience a plus
* Proven experience in planning, executing, and optimizing paid marketing campaigns, with a strong emphasis on lead generation
* Experience with data visualization tools like Looker Studio, Microsoft PowerBI, or Tableau
* Proficient in Microsoft Excel, including the ability to use formulas and generate tables and visuals
* Google ads certification a plus
* Creative mindset and the ability to craft compelling ad copy and design elements
* Basic knowledge of HTML/CSS, CRM platforms, and website or landing page creation a plus
* Strong attention to detail
* Ability to organize, prioritize, and multi-task
* Results-oriented, analytical, and a problem-solver
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills
* Comfortable working in a remote environment, multi-location experience a plus


We believe our greatest assets are our employees, we offer competitive salaries and a full benefits package to include, PTO, paid holidays, 401(k) and more.
  
  

Authority Brands Inc. conducts drug screens and background checks on applicants who accept employment offers. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions however we do not sponsor Visa’s at this time.
  
  

Authority Brands Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer

title: Digital Marketing Specialist
description:
Welcome to PFU America, an established leader in the Document Imaging industry, delivering innovative scanning solutions and services that enable our customers to solve critical business productivity and streamline operations.


We are also the proud creators of Happy Hacking Keyboard (HHKB), which strives to be the best performing, highest quality and most satisfying line of keyboards on the planet. Born from the vision of a perfect computer keyboard, HHKB has become the go-to digital companion for programmers, gamers, hackers and high-performance keyboard enthusiasts over the past 25 years.


While our headquarters is based in the heart of Silicon Valley in Santa Clara, CA, our teams do great work from just about anywhere. We offer excellent benefits and an inclusive culture that rewards hard work and teamwork, encourages intellectual growth and celebrates diversity.


Learn more about PAI here: https://www.pfu.fujitsu.com/us/


Learn more about our products here: www.pfu.ricoh.com/us


Our marketing team is looking for someone who has a good foundational understanding of web and ecommerce development, content management, and reporting to join our team as a Web Administrator. As a Digital Marketing Specialist, you will be responsible for developing and optimizing content and imagery across all our websites to support our marketing plans. Our brands and websites cover a range of consumer and business-oriented consumer electronics and software.


Responsibilities:


* Manage day-to-day operation of multiple websites
* Assist with ideation, development, management and maintenance of all web pages
* Work amongst cross-functional teams to produce and publish dynamic content for sites regarding product releases and new initiatives
* Manage relationships and concerns with all web related 3rd party agencies and platforms
* Provide careful attention to detail on all elements pre and post publishing


Analyze and report for all websites:


* Weekly and Monthly reporting of key metrics
* Evaluate and analyze sales trends by product and category
* Evaluate traffic channels and look for opportunities to expand sales and drive engagement
* Provide support for SEO, Keyword Research, Google Analytics, Website UX, Product Marketing, and Digital Merchandising


Ecommerce specific responsibilities:


* Manage store catalog of products
* Manage all store messaging: email templates, FAQs, contact information, terms of sale, etc
* Act as a source of authority to resolve customer service issues
* Work cross-functionally to resolve any technical issues
* Provide ideas to solve all identified issues and improvement opportunities
* Manage all store promotional activities from inception to close
* Manage outbound ecommerce marketing activities


Website and e-Commerce Specialist experience desired:


* 3-5 years experience in a fast-paced web and e-Commerce position
* Hands-on experience in managing and maintaining a company website and e-Commerce site
* Familiarity with web design and close attention to detail
* Bachelor’s degree or equivalent work experience in marketing, digital design or relevant field
* Knowledge of CMS systems, preferably experience with Sitecore and BigCommerce platforms
* Knowledge of SEO standards, experience developing content and optimizing for SEO
* CMS and front-end website development experience


Experience producing imagery and graphics for web Personal skills desired:


* Ability to manage multiple tasks at once (flexible and self-sufficient)
* Outstanding time management and organizational skills
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills
* Ability to work in a self-directed, fast-paced environment
* Positive attitude, self-motivated, confident, and tenacious
* Must be able to work in a team environment while maintaining independence
* Work well amongst cross-functional teams
* Strong project management skills


**Salary Range:**


* $85,000 to $120,000, plus bonus
* Location - US Remote

title: Customer Support Representative [Contract]
description:
Founded by educators and technologists passionate about improving education, Clever is on a mission to unlock new ways to learn for all students. Already used by more than 75% of U.S. K-12 schools, Clever brings all applications into one secure portal and provides single sign-on for everyone. With the leading network of digital learning providers, Clever makes school more engaging, personalized, and fun.


We are looking for Customer Support Representatives to help us deliver outstanding customer experience for our school district and application partners through fast, friendly, and personalized technical support. If you're interested in connecting with customers via email and phone calls, growing knowledge of the EdTech industry and Clever's product, and creatively solving technical issues, this is a great opportunity to do all that while connecting every student to a world of learning. We have a highly collaborative and supportive team. We invest in our people. We have a robust 3-week onboarding program and then you'll be in our Quality Assurance program for ongoing development. We want to make you successful, and have structures in place to support you!

  


**A DAY IN THE LIFE:**


* Independently manage and prioritize high seasonal volume of customer support requests via phone and email from your individual queue (handle around 40+ phone and email cases a day).
* Communicate with District Administrators and our Application Partners to resolve product related issues as our customers are getting their Clever accounts ready for the new school year.
* Utilize analytical and problem solving skills to investigate, test, and troubleshoot system features.
* Navigate and contribute to internal and external product documentation.
* Collaborate and support the team by sharing ideas and knowledge, being a reliable team member, and willing to help others when needed.


Interested to learn more? Check out our blog post on A Day in the Life at Clever for a Customer Solutions Representative

  


**WHAT WE'RE LOOKING FOR:**


* Experience in fast-paced customer-facing positions: you have worked email or phone support before and can independently assess, manage and prioritize support requests based on need (i.e priority levels, deadline) and risk.
* Passion for solving technical problems to help others: you work deeply to understand customers' perspectives to assess their needs and define technical solutions to help them achieve their goals..
* Comfort navigating ambiguity: you may encounter problems or situations that we have not seen before – you are comfortable with partnering with the customer to find a solution and document learnings.
* Excellent communication skills: you can explain technical concepts to both technical and non-technical audiences and can communicate and empathize with stakeholders to drive issues to resolution.
* Technical Prowess: you pick up new technology quickly and love learning how things work.
* Team player: you are passionate about uplifting and collaborating with others to ensure the team and customers are successful.
* Interest in education: you believe in Clever's mission of making it easy to bring great software to the classroom.
* Bonus:
+ Experience handling issues related to data imports and integrations
+ Experience working with Single Sign On (SSO) or have a basic understanding of SSO
+ Experience working with or in K-12 schools or districts
+ Experience with industry tools such as Salesforce, Slack, Guru, Confluence, Sigma, etc

* Ability to work during one of the following shifts (Monday - Friday):
+ **7am - 3:30pm ET**
+ **7am - 3:30pm PT**
+ **9am - 5:30pm ET**
+ **9am - 5:30pm PT**

* Ability to work overtime: during mid-August through mid-September, it is expected to work up to 2-4 hours of overtime a day (overtime paid at 1.5x hourly rate).
* Commitment to equity and belonging: at Clever, we believe the classrooms we serve and our company's halls should be spaces that are diverse, equitable, and inclusive. That is why we are committed to building diverse teams, inviting every voice, and creating a safe space for everyone to be their authentic self. By fostering equity and belonging within our circles of influence, we unlock learning for ALL students.

  


**SALARY TRANSPARENCY:**



Compensation for this role for candidates living in the United States, besides NYC and San Francisco, CA, is **$25 per hour**. For candidates living in NYC and San Francisco, CA is **$28 per hour**.

 **Clever does not conduct interviews via text or Telegram. We will never ask for your financial information or reimbursement of equipment of any kind. If you receive any communications regarding employment with Clever that you think might be a scam, please email security@clever.com.**

title: Digital Marketing Manager
description:
Kiva Confections (www.kivaconfections.com) is a world-class cannabis-infused edibles company in California, the largest cannabis market in the world. Kiva's line includes Kiva Chocolate Bars, Terra Bites, Petra Mints, Lost Farms Gummies & Chews, and Camino Gummies. Our products are crafted from premium ingredients and thoughtfully combined with California cannabis. Since our beginning in 2010, our goal has been to create confections that redefine what a cannabis confection ought to be. By applying art and science, we ensure a deliciously consistent experience.  

We have high-reaching growth plans as the legal market and consumer adoption expand. Key growth initiatives include ambitious platform innovation, outstanding marketing, geographic expansion, strategic partnerships, and more. We are resourced for this spectacular growth and looking for great people to help take us to the next level.  

Are you a digital marketing enthusiast with a proven track record of developing and executing successful cross-channel strategies? Do you have a passion for the cannabis industry and a drive to lead innovative digital initiatives? If so, we have an exciting opportunity for you!  

We are seeking a Digital Marketing Manager to drive our digital and web marketing strategies for Kiva confections, Camino, Lost Farm, Petra and Terra. In this role, you will be responsible for implementing content strategies, overseeing digital growth initiatives, and collaborating with internal and external teams to achieve business goals on both the cannabis and hemp digital platforms. Your role will be vital in enhancing brand presence, optimizing customer engagement through digital channels, and supporting our DTC efforts.
### **As Digital Marketing Manager, you will...**

* Execute omni channel marketing strategies from optimization to reporting, ensuring alignment with company objectives.
* Manage digital advertising efforts, including budgeting and collaborating with Brand, Creative and E-Comm teams on ad creative for both cannabis and hemp sites
* Manages and grows the Digital Marketing Associate shared with the Director of E-Commerce
* Implement marketing strategies for third-party cannabis listing/ordering sites (e.g., Weedmaps, Leafly, I Heart Jane, Dutchie) to enhance brand presence and value for retail partners.
* Work with the Director of E-Comm and agencies to maintain and update best-in-class websites for our brands.
* Develop and implement SEO strategies to improve organic rankings and search traffic, with ongoing performance reporting.
* Maintain a monthly digital marketing calendar aligned with overall marketing initiatives and promotional activities.
* Collaborate with the creative team and brand managers to develop campaign assets that adhere to brand guidelines.
* Coordinate campaigns, and report on performance in collaboration with the Social Media and PR team.
* Analyze digital channel performance metrics to drive future marketing decisions.
* Generate monthly reports and assess the performance of all digital marketing campaigns on both cannabis and hemp sites.
* Understand technical limitations and opportunities working with a compliant heavy landscape

### **What we're looking for...**

* Bachelor's or Master's degree in Marketing, Communications, or a related field.
* Proficiency in digital marketing tools (e.g., Web CMS, Google Analytics, etc.).
* 5+ years of experience in digital marketing, website management, and social media.
* Strong knowledge of social media platforms (e.g., Instagram, LinkedIn, Twitter, etc.).
* Proven track record of managing SEO/SEM, marketing database, email, and social media campaigns.
* Experience with third-party and e-commerce platforms.
* Strong numerical and analytical skills for data interpretation.
* Effective communication and project management skills.
* Genuine passion for and interest in the cannabis industry.
* Prior cannabis or hemp industry experience is a plus.


Please note, we consider a number of factors such as internal pay parity, relevant experience/skills, geographic location, etc.
Kiva Confections provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.
